choices: James goes to his room to check out the ring in private.
He decides to invite Eric over to look at the ring together.
He calls up his girlfriend, Lauren, and arranges a date for tonight.
He decides to go to the mall and see if the ring really works.
James puts the ring away and decides to worry about it tomorrow.
1.content:
"I'm telling you, man, she's been out of your league for a while now, why did she ever start dating you in the first place?" James asked his best friend Eric as they walked home from school.

"Na… that's just all in your head James. No girl is out of your league if you talk to her right. Kim and I get along great, she's just busy that's all." Eric shrugged.

James noticed the sky was getting dark quite fast, and felt a few rain drops hitting his scruffy brown hair. He thought it was sunny a few minutes ago… but he thought nothing of it.

James then shook his head, "But dude she's gorgeous, don't you get it? I hardly ever see you two together, and guys are gonna get the idea that she's single. She won't have any trouble finding a new boyfriend if she thinks you're not there for her."

"You don't understand, that's just how she is. Kim's the captain of the volleyball team and a million other after school clubs. That's just how it is dating such a popular girl." Eric then paused and turned to James, "But hey you're one to talk. When's the last time you and Lauren went out on a date? Like a real date, not counting eating lunch in the cafeteria and then going home and playing video games with her?"

"Man, Lauren's different, we've got a good thing going. She gets me and I get her. I know she doesn't need fancy dinners or anything like that to like me." James said proudly.

Eric said, "I don't know… you should treat her every now and then. I don't think you understand girls as much as you think you do. Girls have needs just like us."

James was about to retort when he noticed the rain had gotten much heavier in the last few minutes. The storm had blown in from seemingly nowhere. The two guys decided to hurry their pace, until there was a flash of light just ahead. What looked like a giant bolt from the sky fell down at hypersonic speeds, impacting just feet away from James. The impact knocked both him and Eric to the ground, and when they finally looked up, James saw a crater in the grass, which left a hole exposing the soil underneath. James brushed the dirt off his clothes and stood up to get a better look. There didn't seem to be anything other than the crater of dirt around, so he walked up to it and got a closer look.

"James what are you doing?! Do you wanna get struck by lightning or something? Get down on the ground!" Eric yelled out to his friend.

"It's fine, that wasn't lightning. Something fell, like I don’t know, a meteorite or something. Lightning doesn't make a crater like this." James said as he peered into the small crater in the grass, which had already started filling up with rainwater.

"How do you know? You're a geologist now?" Eric snarked.

James ignored his friend and started clearing the water out of the hole, sloshing his hands around in the mud. He was sure he'd seen a glint of something inside a second ago, and then…

"Aha! There it is…" James said quietly to himself.

He felt something solid on his finger, as he fished out a tiny metallic object. He thought it would be hot, but it appeared to be made of a dark metallic substance that was already cool to the touch. Once he brushed the mud off of it, he realized it was a ring. As he held it in his hand, he suddenly felt a jolt and his mind was overwhelmed by a flood of information.

The ring spoke to him directly into his mind, "Hello human. You're wondering what I am. In your language I can be described as a Trait Swapping Alchemical Ring, but my true name has no translation. The wearer of such a ring will be granted the ability to alter the beings around them at will, both in body and mind. It's not my place to tell you what to do with me, so good luck, human."

When James recovered, he realized he now knew the basic capabilities of the ring, and what it supposedly could do. He wasn't sure if he really believed it, or if that was all just some hallucination. Regardless, he decided it would be best to inspect it in private. He quickly hid the ring in his pocket and turned back to Eric.

Eric had been watching him curiously, but hadn't seen what he found. "You done over there? Can we go before we're soaked even more? Did you find your valuable meteorite?" Eric asked sarcastically.

"Na just a big muddy hole in the ground is all." James said, and joined back up with his friend as they hurried back home to get out of the rain.

The two friends parted ways and went to their respective homes which were only one street away from each other. James finally got in the front door of his house and…
1.title: The Ring Appears

choices: James decides to redecorate his room
James makes a swap with his mom
11.content:
James returned home after 'finding' the ring. He went straight to his room and closed the door. He had to think. He wanted to try the ring out but he didn't want to go outside with it until he knew it could do what it 'said' it could do. He had to try it out on someone but only his mom, Heather and his annoying younger sister Audrey were home. He didn't want to swap between the two of them. He didn't know what to swap between them that he could tell and that wouldn't cause too much trouble if either of them noticed the swap. He decided to swap one of them with himself so he could tell there was a change.

It was approaching five o'clock by the time James was ready. He left his room to see what is mom and sister were up to. His mom was making dinner and he didn't want to disturb her. His sister was sitting on the couch waiting for her show to come on. Audrey always watched the lamest shows, it would be better if she would watch something good like COPS or whatever was on ESPN. James decided to swap his watching preferences with Audrey. He was sure that he could convince himself how lame what she was and maybe when he swapped back she would want to watch something good.

"Can I sit here?" James asked Audrey.

"If you must, but iCarly is coming on and I am going to watch it."

"We'll watch anything you want," James said with a snicker. Then he made the switch. iCarly had just started. James watched it for a while waiting for something to happen. He didn't know why he had hated this show so much, it was fun and upbeat. The main character was a girl but she did like computers. In a couple of minutes, Audrey decided to change the channel. She put on 'COPS." It was then that James realized that his experiment totally worked. He decided to go to his room to celebrate. On the way to his room James caught sight of the hair on his arms and it totally disgusted him. He didn't know why he would let his body grow so hairy it was totally icky. Maybe he should take a shower and shave it off. He might do that, but first there was some celebrating to do.

What happens next?
11.title: James goes to his room to check out the ring in...

choices: Swap with his little sister again
111.content:
Before he could do anything else, his Mom called out from the kitchen: "Dinner's ready."

Audrey shut the television off and hopped up from the couch. As she walked away, James swapped back their preferences. She shook her head, but kept walking to the kitchen. The thoughts about iCarly were still there, faded but there. It was an interesting show, and he could see why Audrey enjoyed it. Not that he did anymore, but he could see it.

James sat down beside his sister, his mom sitting across from them. Their dad wasn't home yet, but it wasn't unusual. He worked late sometimes, and really any time he didn't have to hear about how wonderful his brother was or see him give some gift to his sister was a good day. His mom at least didn't seem to mind him - though she still did more things with Audrey.

While his sister and mother made small talk about this days, James thought about the ring still on his finger. He could make any number of changes, but he had to be careful. Twenty minutes and he still was thinking iCarly and really anything Audrey liked to watch was still interesting. He didn't want to make any major change, but with great risk came great rewards.

Swapping something physical may be less dangerous then a personality trait like preferences. He glanced at his mother and then his sister. It would be so easy to swap something from either of them. Maybe a piece of clothing, or a body part, or their hair.

Or he could swap something between the two of them.
111.title: Mom calls everyone to dinner

choices: Make another swap - between his parents
1111.content:
Jame figured he'd stick with something simple. He already switched preferences with her, and really there wasn't anything too wrong with him. Yes, he still was intrigued by iCarly, and maybe wanted to watch it with his little sister later. Right now, he wanted to try something else from her.

Her hair was braided in an odd style, like something that Daenerys wore. She made it look so simple and with her auburn hair. The braids wrapped over one another, and still left a large fall of hair on her back. She had been so proud when she finally got managed to complete the braid - much to her friends envy. They all tried, and some succeeded, but that only sparked Audrey to try newer things. Today was one of her simpler braids, and it still looked great. Why not try it?

The thought was enough to make the switch with a blink of an eye. One second his sister was tossing her braid over her shoulder, and the next, he felt the weight pulling on his skull. He never had long hair before, and he wanted to take a look in the mirror. Right now, his sister wore his messy short hair cut, and still looked like a cute girl.

"We need to get you to the salon," his mom said to Audrey.

"No, I don't," Audrey said, rolling her eyes. "Its fine."

"Just a little work and you'd be great. You're brother takes great care of his hair, why can't you?"

James paused as he was bringing a broccoli stalk to his mouth. He hadn't expected to get her grooming habits, but he had memories of braiding his hair, taking care of her - his hair and spending the time growing it out. "Mom, leave her alone. If she wants to, she'll go with us."

"Its just something that all of us could do." His mom turned back to Audrey. "Just think about it, okay? I think it would be fun."

Audrey shrugged her shoulders and made eye contact with him. He gave her a smile, not really knowing what to say right now. "Maybe. Let me think about it."

Definitely the weirdest conversation he ever had. But fun. Maybe this change wouldn't be so bad. He wanted to keep it a little longer and see what other things changed. The rest of dinner was uneventful, and even his father showing up as they were clearing the dishes brought no surprises.
1111.title: Swap with his little sister again

choices: No more swaps until the next day
11111.content:
James took the stairs two at a time, his hair brushing against his back. He went straight to the bathroom that he and his sister shared. He slipped in, closed the door behind him, and stared at the image before him.

Audrey's hair reached the center of his back, much like it did to her. It was soft, softer than his ever was, and he spent a few minutes just touching it. The hair changed his face as well. His face looked longer, and skin looked a little darker with the lighter hair. He wasn't sure, but his face felt smoother as well.

"this is amazing," he whispered. he couldn't believe how normal it looked and felt to have long hair. His fingers slowly began to break the braids. With it completely loose, his hair reached a little further back than he expected. There was no difference in style or feel to his hair, but he wanted to brush it out all the same.

When he stepped out of the bathroom, Audrey stood there, staring up at him. She looked younger with his short, almost crew cut, and more of a boy than before. "You think it would help?"

"What?" James asked.

"I mean, I know its not much, but I like my hair like this," she said. She ran a hand over her hair. "Its me, but the other girls....sometimes..." This wasn't the Audrey he knew. She was fearless, wading into crowds and taking them over. Now, she looked smaller.

James didn't know why he did it. They weren't close before, but maybe that was because the change in preferences for television shows, except he wasn't that heartless. Despite not liking her sometimes, Audrey still was his sister. He wrapped her in a hug and pulled her against him. He thought about switching their hair back to ease the guilt, but he still wanted to see how the played out. He wanted to know what Lauren thought of his hair. "You can be whoever you want to. And if you want short hair, that's fine. You can grow it out, or they can style it, or you can do nothing. just be you."

They stood their for a little bit longer. It was more interaction than they normally had in the month, but it felt good to connect with his sister. "I'm going to get changed for bed. Maybe we can watch some iCarly or something when I'm done."

"Really? you're not just saying that?" He kind of was, but also wasn't. The preferences still stuck a little. He knew that the show wasn't what he would have preferred, but he did want to cheer her up a bit. He could manage to sit through one episode for his little sister.

"No." James shook his head, sending his hair flying a bit. "I need to brush my hair anyway. Might as well spend some time with you." Audrey squealed and hugged him tightly before letting him go.

"Maybe...maybe I will go with, next time you and Mom go to the salon," Audrey said, a nervous smile on her face. She hurried into the bathroom and shut the door, leaving James standing in the middle of the hallway with his auburn hair.

"How the hell can hair change all that?" He shook his head and headed to his room to get ready for bed.
11111.title: Head up to his room

choices: Make a quick swap before heading to school
111111.content:
The rest of the night was kind of slow. He sat down with Audrey, watching iCarly, and he surprisingly wasn't bored. Maybe it was the soothing movements of brushing his hair that kept him there. Maybe it was fantasizing about what he could swap with everyone at school. Or maybe it was just realizing his sister wasn't quite as bad as he thought and didn't have awful taste in shows. It wasn't great, but she enjoyed it.

His mom even approved, which again, was weird, but welcome.

Of course, his Dad ignored them in favor of reading some thing on his tablet. He did say goodnight to Audrey, and after a moment hesitation him.

All because he swapped hair with his sister. Well, maybe not all, but definitely most of it.

James sat on his bed, staring at the mirror above his dresser. in front of it, were several ties, a few bows, and even cutesy hair clips. All things he knew Audrey had before, and they were now his. Before he changed for bed, he pulled his hair up into a topknot in a series of movements he never knew before. His fingers nimbly tied off his hair, away from his neck and ready for bed. He'd seen his sister wearing it in a similar fashion hundreds of mornings before, so it stood to reason that he would wear it that way too.

Taking off his shirt, James stared at his hairless chest for a moment before tossing his shirt into his hamper. He didn't notice the lack of hair underneath his armpits, and thought nothing of his hairless arms. Taking off his pants, he didn't even notice his hairless legs either. And if he bothered to check, he would have not noticed the spare auburn hair around his crotch. When he switched hair with Audrey, he switched all of her hair. Even his eyebrows were shaped like hers. Not that he noticed or even cared at the moment. The longer he wore her hair, the longer it would take for him to forget that it was ever hers in the first place.

His night was kind of fitful, his sleep punctured by nightmares of swaps going horrifically wrong and fantasies of everything he could be with swaps. From a Fabio with auburn hair flowing in the wind with muscles to punch out the Rock, to a red-headed vixen with a large bust and an amazing ass, everything he could be and maybe wanted to be. With the ring, he could do that. And more. All with red-hair of course.

James sat up before his mother pounded on his door. He got up nearly half an hour earlier than he normally did, and without thinking about it, headed straight to the bathroom. He picked up Audrey's morning habits, showering to clean his long hair and slowly began to blow draw it out. The mixture of hair products helped keep his hair soft and smooth, easy to brush. Instead of taking the five to ten minutes he normally did, he now spent the better part of forty minutes in the bathroom cleaning his near hairless body and drying his hair.

James passed Audrey in the hallway, who smirked at him as he walked by with a towel around his waist and a towel around his head with his hair. At least she got to enjoy sleeping in.

Once dressed, James stared at the mirror again for several minutes. His mind played over what he could do with his hair, how he could braid it, let it hang, or even just put it up in a ponytail. There was not quite countless possibilities, but definitely an infinite more than he had before. He kept it simply today: a high ponytail just below the crown of his head. His hair swung behind him as he hopped down the stairs to great his mom and sister. His dad left for the day already, and again, one less surprising thing about all this.

Maybe that could change. Swap something about him with someone who cared for their family. Or swap how his dad saw him. Maybe get spoiled like his sister or praised like his brother.

"Morning," his mom said. "Do you want breakfast?" She motioned toward the table where Audrey sat. She was dressed exactly the same, with nothing spectacular about her hair. It was utterly plain, like his had been the day before.
111111.title: No more swaps until the next day

1111113.content:
"No thanks," he said. He grabbed his backpack, pulled his hair out from beneath his backpack and headed out the door. He wanted to get out of there before he made any more swaps.

Thankfully, it was a nice day out, so he could walk to school His hair swung slightly as he walked, flickin his neck on some odds steps. It wasn't a long walk to school, and he was planning on meeting up with Lauren. He wanted to know what she thought of his hair, and maybe get a few tips.

As he walked, a group of kids were standing waiting for the bus. He stopped to give them a look. Three boys and two girls stood in a line. The boys were all wearing jeans and some type of t-shirt. He couldn't really tell, but that didn't matter too much. One of the girls was wearing a light colored dress with black mary janes and the other was wearing a jean skirt.

It didn't take much, by the time he was passed them, girls were no wearing jeans and two of the boys were in the skirt and dresses. No one thought any different, but the boys stopped messing around with a puddle of mud while one of the girls jumped right into them.

"Everything okay?" James turned, his ponytail flipped to smack him in the face. Lauren was standing with a large smile on her face.

"Yeah," he said, returning the smile. "Everything's great." She wrapped him in a hug, and gave him a quick kiss on the lips before stepping back. "May be going to the salon this weekend with my mom and Audrey."

"Really? Audrey's going with?" And she doesn't find the hair weird. Okay, so the swapping was definitely dangerous. "That's great."

"I thought so," James said, not really knowing how it would be play out, but he didn't feel too bad. Maybe it would make his sister easier to deal instead of the spoiled princess.

They talked about nothing the rest of the way to school. As more students gathered to head to class, James spotted more and more swaps to make, felt that tenuous grip on his control slipping away. Even if people didn't notice, he would, and that would be enough to have some fun. Plus, why not get hte body he wants.

He'll keep the hair though.
1111113.title: Something else

11111131.content:
For the most part, the cheerleaders weren't bad people. A little annoying perhaps, but not bad. No where nearly as bad as the football players.

The football players, particularly the quarterback, fulfilled the bingo card for every single bad trope about high school. Jackson lead the group and decided who to bully. Not the most creative guy in the world, so maybe it was time to make another trait swap.

David spotted the perfect target to swap traits: Tracey Holt was a freshman. She was kind, but very solitary. He knew Lauren talked to her sometimes, and that Tracey had friends, but she wasn't popular. Far from it in fact. A quiet band kid who just wanted to get through high school. Still, she was not a jock, and a target for the jocks.

Jackson was throwing a football to another player, some wide receiver. As the ball left his hand, David swapped all of Jackson's football knowledge with Tracey's. He watched Tracey stumble a bit, but she kept walking without a glance back at the commotion of Jackson' missing the returned throw. The ball slammed into his face, and his cursing alerted everyone to his failure.

"Couldn't happen to a nicer guy," Lauren said through her giggles.

David nodded, and smiled. "I know." He thought about making another swap, but let Tracey and Jackson enjoy the swap. Not that Tracey would think it was odd or different. Jackson on the other hand.

"Besides your sister agreeing to go with you and your mom, anything else happen last night?"

"Okay," she drew out the word as she looked around her. "Chelsey - anything?"

David spotted Chelsey standing in the middle of a group of cheerleaders. she was probably one od the standard of beautiful people in the school - despite being two years younger. Part of that was her natural charm, but the other part was she grew early. She did not have the largest breasts in the school, but it was a close. Her blonde hair hung just below her shoulders with a trim, fit athletic body.

"Her breasts," Lauren said. "But what does that - what?"

As she spoke, David made the swap. Lauren's chest began to grow, straining her shirt as Chelsey's shrunk. There was not much change for the cheerleader. None of the girls noticed, and Chelsey looked less like a stripper, though Lauren kind of did now. "I learned I could do that?"

"What? These ..but mine...how?"

"I'm not quite sure about everything, but I learned I could swap traits and body parts between people - as long as I can see them." David said. He slung his arm around his shoulder. "So?"

"This is amazing," Lauren's hands went to her new breasts but dropped. "I..I can't believe they're on my body."

"They're yours now."

"What else can you do? is there a limit?" Lauren's voice began to race as she tried to release all of her questions at once. She almost started hopping, but kept still against his body. David flipped his auburn hair back over his shoulder and laughed.

1111113112.content:
Lauren leaned up, her now large breasts pressed against his chest. "Have fun in gym."

James watched his girlfriend go, surprised at how easily she was taking her new breasts. They looked enormous on her, and he wondered if the rest of the world saw anything different or if they always thought she had them. None of he other students were acting.

He headed off to gym. Despite being a senior, he still had to take the class. He wasn't in bad shape, but definitely not the most athletic or fittest person there. Maybe he could use the swapping ability to reduce that deficiency.

He slipped into the locker room and quickly changed. Your gaze never lingers in the locker room. Ever. This wasn't the place for him to swap and he didn't want to chance fucking this up. Again. He nearly did with the tv preferences, and didn't want to mess anything up like that again.

James tied his hair into a messy bun. Nothing fancy, but nothing to get in the way of gym. He didn't want his hair to get too sweaty, so hopeful wouldn't have to wash his hair after gym. It meant a longer shower, and he didn't want to spend any more time in there than he had to - much like all of gym.

"Took you long enough," Jack said. Jack was a few inches taller than him, but definitely built for sports. He played basketball, and while not a starter, was good enough to play throughout a game. Maybe he'd switch with him. Or another atheltic. He watched some of the girls stretching.

They weren't cheerleaders, but they were fit. Softball players the lot of them. He wondered what it would be like to have those skills. There were a few gymnasts as well, but he never was interested in that. Softball was basically baseball, right?

Jame was not the star athlete in his family - that was reserved for his older brother. Still getting a bit of that skill wouldn't be a bad thing. Now he just had to decide - basketball or softball? And how? the simplest way would be to swap skills, but there was no way his body was trained for it.

He contemplated the problem as he lined up. His friends kept talking around him as Ms Anders took attendance and then sent them off on a run. It was hard to talk to anyone and run at the same time, so it gave him a chance to think of which sport he wanted to play, or at least be good at.

It took a long while to brush his now much much much longer hair. Frankly, it was starting to get tedious. But eventually he did and then as promised he went down to watch iCarly with his sister Audrey. James could remember liking it, but it wasn't as much fun now that he was actually watching.

Then what was obviously his mother came into the room. Audrey had really gotten into this, but James just couldn't get into it. He wished he did for Audrey's sake.

When a commercial came around, Audrey's phone played its tune indicating a call. From what James could hear, it was Audrey's best friend Ellie. She was also watching iCarly and called Audrey to talk about what they just saw. iCarly had been on for years and this was just a repeat (as all the iCarlys) but it was new to them. Audrey was so excited about what they just saw and was speaking excitedly with Ellie. For a moment, James wished he could be so excited about something like that.

Then James came up with an idea, maybe he could swap preferences with Ellie who was on the phone and then he could enjoy the show with Audrey. That would be fun. He wasn't sure if it would work, but he would try to swap his TV preferences with Ellie over the phone.

Then he heard it, "...the commercial is about over. I'll call back when it's over." Audrey was about to hang up the phone. James didn't have time to set everything and so he swapped quickly. He only meant to swap Ellie's TV preferences, but instead swapped all of her preferences. Not just for TV, but everything else. How Ellie felt about a thing, James felt about it. If she liked it, he liked it. If she hated it, he hated it. He now had all the preferences of a thirteen year old girl.

What happens next?

1151.content:
Now that James tried some of Audrey's soaps and other products he realized how superior they were to his products. A tinge of jealousy welled from with inside him and he decided that he was the older one and should have some of those things. He swapped ownership of some of Audrey's bath products with his own. Besides he was almost all out anyway, let her get some new stuff he reasoned.

After the shower, James decided he should get some homework done. But before starting he took a moment to look at his new ring. It was a nice ring he thought, but it would be better if it was a bracelet. The ring enlarged and shifted itself to his wrist as a thin bracelet. But a thin bracelet like that didn't look good on his wrist it was too girly to ever look good on a man's wrist. He changed it to a chain which looked better but was still too girly to look good on him. He made the links in the chain bigger and bigger until he found the size he liked. The ring now looked like a bracelet with links in that boardline area between a girls bracelet and something a man might wear. He liked it now.

Getting to back to work he took out his homework. Instead of the cursive he usually wrote in he decided to write in script. He let the letters flow from on letter to the other in a smooth style that he liked.

After homework was over, he noticed his notebook was a bit plain. Ideas went through his head about how to decorate his book. At first he thought that stickers would look good on the cover of his notebooks. But what stickers? He didn't know. He thought that girl on iCarly was cute, but maybe not that. He'd go and buy some stickers at the 99 cent store when he had a chance. But what he could do was put hearts all over the pages of his notebook. He thought the pages would look so good with J & L written in cute hearts. Soon he would skip the J & L and just put hearts or maybe stars. He wished it was earlier so he could go to the 99 cents store and buy the stickers. But it was too late, dinner would be ready soon, plus it was still raining anyway.
1151.title: James swaps ownership of some of Audrey's s...

choices: James finally realizes he's been acting odd tonight...
James feels like using the ring on his sister or mother for some reason.
11511.content:
"Hey James! Dinner!" His mother called from downstairs.

He was starving and quickly stopped drawing hearts and little J&L's, and put his notebook away. There would be plenty of time to decorate that later, but for now he was starving. He hurried downstairs and smelled the delicious food. Without realizing it, he sat down next to his mother, in the seat that Audrey always took.

"Oh James? That's Audrey's seat isn't it?" Heather, his mother asked.

Then Audrey sat down in James's usual seat next to Nick, her father, "It's fine mom, I like sitting over here by dad anyways."

Their father seemed pleased that his daughter was being so friendly, but he didn't say a word as usual.

Heather paused for a second, before continuing, "Oh ok… sure. Well tonight we're having some spicy roast chicken and noodles, and yes Audrey I know you don't like spicy foods, so I went easy on yours."

James stopped to admire how lucky he was to have a mom that cooked decent meals, and cared about preparing them just right for each of her kids. He wondered where she found the time to work as a teacher, being busy all the time, and then come home and cook a full dinner at night. She must have learned some really quick recipes at one point, was that her secret?

Without realizing it, James had just swapped all of his mother's cooking knowledge for his own. He knew exactly how to prepare all of the things she usually made, but since he wasn't dwelling on it, he didn't notice the new knowledge. At the moment it just seemed silly of him to wonder these things now, because he knew exactly what recipe she used to make a quick dinner.

"Thanks Mom, it smells great." James said as he took a bite. His eyes went wide, "Whoa! Jesus! Mom you went waay overboard on the spiciness!"

James took a huge drink of water to cool his mouth down, and his mother looked very concerned. "I didn't put any more than usual…" Heather said.

"I don't know mine's incredibly plain… Mind if I try some of James's?" Audrey asked. Without waiting for a response, Audrey stole a bite off James's plate, and she seemed to like it. "Oh I don't know what James's freaking about… this is great!"

In the end, James and Audrey traded dinners, and he found that the non-spicy plate was much more bearable to him. He thought nothing of it, but wondered if maybe mom messed up her recipe?

"You know mom, maybe tomorrow I can help you out? I've got some recipes of my own I want to try out…" James offered.

Audrey laughed, "You? Cook? James you couldn't cook to save your life!"

But their mom shook her head and smiled, "I'm sure James knows a lot more than I do I'm sure. I'm honestly not even sure how I managed to pull this meal off, luck I guess. I'd love if you helped me out James, we don't do enough Mother/Son bonding…"

Suddenly their father chimed in, "Son are you sure about this? You never expressed interest in cooking before, though I guess your mother could teach you if you want. It's a skill you're going to need to learn when you go off to college…"

James rolled his eyes, "Oh don't worry about me, daddy, if anything I'll teach her!"

Heather and Nick looked at each other strangely when James called him "daddy." He hasn't called his father that since he was a young kid, and he was definitely acting strange earlier too. They said nothing to each other, but they knew what the other was thinking.

Nick simply smiled, "Alright then Jimmy, I look forward to seeing what you can come up with tomorrow!"

He called his son "Jimmy" a name he hadn't used for his son since his son was old enough to call him "daddy". He did this on purpose hoping his son was just playing a joke on him, but James didn't laugh, he didn't even seem fazed by being called his childhood nickname. Normally he insisted people call him James…
11511.title: James forgets what his swap was

choices: James has alot of fun looking at prom dresses
James fantasizes about wearing a dress
115112.content:
After dinner, James went into the livingroom to watch some TV. He settled on 'Austin & Ally' on the Disney channel. While he was watching, Lauren called. They got to talking and Lauren said that she was going to look at Prom Dresses tomorrow.

"Prom dresses already, but the prom is more than four months away," James said.

"I know that silly, but it takes time to find the right dress."

"But four months."

"Well its not only picking out the right dress, but you also have to wait for it to arrive and then you have to have it altered. It takes a long time. You can never start too early."

"Oh, OK."

"Do you want to go help me pick out the dress?"

When asked, the idea seemed like a lot of fun. It wasn't gay to just look at dresses. He wasn't going to try them on. Besides seeing Lauren in beautiful dresses sounded like a great idea. There was one problem. He didn't know anything about dresses and he didn't want to seem like a fool. "Yes, let's go." James said impulsively.

"Really?"

James did want to go, it did sound like a lot of fun, but his male ego which would have made him hesitate also made him not back out. "Yeah, I'd love to see you in all those pretty things."

"Great."

Then the two arranged a time. When James got off the phone he realized that he had to learn about dresses in a hurry so he went to talk to his mom. He explained what had happened and asked her for some pointers. James' mom liked Lauren and wanted to help both Lauren and her son so she tried to teach James the rudiments of dresses. James decided it would be best to just swap all of his mother's knowledge about dresses with his own. This swap didn't have to last long, he could swap it back after the shopping trip was over.

What happens next?
115112.title: James feels like using the ring on his sister o...

choices: James decides to wait outside like a normal boyfriend would.
James makes a swap that lets him infiltrate the changing rooms easily...
1151122.content:
Now that James had all of his mother's knowledge on dresses, his mind was suddenly opened up to the huge variety of dresses out there. His mother wasn't an expert by any means, but she had her share of knowledge on all the dresses she's worn over the years. And she was definitely one to enjoy a good sexy dress. What James didn't realize however, was that in order to get all of her knowledge on dresses, he also acquired peripheral knowledge on all sorts of feminine clothing. His mind was flooded with knowledge and he wondered if Lauren would find it kinky if he cross-dressed. He still had no problem wearing men's clothing, but there was now the itch in the back of his mind that made him curious…

"That settles it I have to go with Lauren for sure now, and make sure she gets the most adorable dress there! And then maybe after prom…" He said to himself as he was going to bed that night.

He went to sleep dreaming about all of the new kinds of feminine clothes he now knew about thanks to his mother's knowledge. He was wearing the most elegant ball gown, but in his dreams he had the female body to fill it out. And Lauren was there in his dream encouraging him and loving him for who he was… Lauren herself was also wearing the fanciest ball gown he could imagine. The two of them were dancing at prom together.

And then he woke up and shook the thoughts out of his head. This was definitely not normal for him. For the first time he was starting to suspect that the ring was messing with his head a little bit, but he couldn't pinpoint it.

"It's only for today… I'll swap back after the shopping trip." James told himself. "This thing is messing with me too much… Maybe I need to hold off on the mental swaps for now."

James got ready for his shopping date with Lauren, and found that he was many times more excited than he'd normally be. With his knew knowledge and desires, he finally understood why his mom always got a kick out of clothes shopping. Lauren was different however. She wasn't the kind of girl to spend all her money on clothes and shoes. She probably owned a small handful of dresses for formal occasions, and the rest of the time she didn't bother with them. He liked Lauren for that reason, she was easier to relate to than most girls. But now he knew he could show her a thing or two about shopping…


They decided to meet up at the mall and work their way to the dress shop to start looking. When he finally saw Lauren at the entrance, they greeted each other with a loving embrace.

"James hey! I'm so glad you agreed to come! This is really not like you, you know? What made you change your mind?" Lauren asked, giving him a quick peck on the cheek and smiling.

"Hey as long as I get to see my beautiful girlfriend while she tries on cute dresses, that's a win-win for both of us right?" James grinned.

"Hmm well that might be hard. It's not like they allow guys into the dressing room." Lauren said, seeming sad that his plan wouldn't work.

"Oh… I didn't think of that. You'll have to come out and show me then?"

"For every single one? James that would take all day! I've gotta try on dozens before I decide which one! If only you could sneak in somehow… I promise I won't tell." Lauren said with a wink, she was obviously joking, but James took her seriously...
1151122.title: James fantasizes about wearing a dress

choices: James manages to sneak into Lauren's changing room by passing as a woman.
It wasn't enough!  The clerk suspects he's a man, and he has to swap more!
Lauren comes out wearing the first dress, and sees James swapping!
11511222.content:
When they finally arrived at the clothing store, James was shocked to see that they weren't the only ones shopping for prom dresses this early. Several of the other girls from school were there with their friends, but Lauren seemed to be the only one who brought her boyfriend. The other girls were free to go into the changing rooms with each other and try on as many as they like, as the clerks helped them out by occasionally bringing more dresses for them to try, and taking the ones they didn't like.

"Oh well James I guess you're gonna have to wait out here. I think I'll get started with this one, it's gorgeous." Lauren said holding up a blue strapless mini-dress that showed off quite a bit of skin.

James thought it would surely look sexy on any girl, including Lauren, but he also preferred if she wore something a bit more modest. The only guy Lauren needed to attract was him, and he already found her attractive as she was.

"I don't know… why don't we start with something else, like this floor length one? It's a little more tasteful right? And try these shoes on while you're at it!" James said as he held up a pair of white heels that matched the dress he'd recommended.

Lauren nodded, "Good choice actually… I don't usually wear these kinds of shoes but they would go great with the dress, how'd you know?"

"Well the strappy style of these shoes is perfect for peeking your legs out from behind the split skirt on this dress. And of course the colors contrast just right." James said as though he was somehow an expert on prom dresses.

Lauren was curious for a second, why he knew so much, but shrugged it off. She took the dress and hurried off to get changed.

While James was waiting, he was dying looking at all the beautiful gowns and dresses of all shapes and sizes. He had no idea where he got this urge to try them all on, but he knew of course he would never fit in them. Of course he was unaware that he had acquired his mother's love of wearing dresses when he got all her knowledge on them. It made him wish he could get away with wearing one. That was when he looked down at the ring on his finger.

"Of course…"

James walked over to the clerk who was carefully hanging up the dresses that girls had rejected. She was a tall and slender blonde who looked like she was in her mid-twenties. He couldn't help but notice how attractive she was, even with the polo shirt store uniform that she was currently wearing.

"Excuse me miss…" James nervously approached the clerk.
"Oh hi.…can I help you?" She asked, seemingly judging him straight away. She was used to getting flirted with by guys in the store, and was automatically paranoid.

"I don't want to bother you, but my girlfriend is here trying on prom dresses today. Does that usually take quite a while?" He asked, trying to fish for information.

The blonde laughed, "Oh yeah, you're gonna be here all day. Better find a seat and get comfortable."

James awkwardly laughed back, "Yeah… Must be rough for you though, you gotta be here for hours while these girls get to play dress up? Must be killing your feet."

She nodded, "Oh yeah, you know I just started my shift actually, so it's going to be a long day for me too… Anyways I gotta get back to work."

When the girl turned back around to continue hanging dresses, James knew he had what he was looking for. This girl wasn't going anywhere for hours, and he could use her to get inside the changing room and surprise Lauren. Of course he'd have to make Lauren believe that it was him…

He squeezed his hand, feeling the ring between his fingers, and focused on swapping some of the girl's physical attributes, making sure she was unaware of the changes. He started with her physique, and slender feminine shape. He found himself slimming in some places, except for his hips which mostly stayed where they were. His shoulders narrowed and his waist pinched inwards slightly. Ever since he'd shaved his legs the other day, he'd wished he was a bit more slender and light. And now that he wished he could wear a dress, he needed the body to fit in one.

Next he swapped the girl's hair. It was long and blonde with beautiful curls, almost like a disney princess or something. Audrey's personality, which influenced his decision, was in love with the hairstyle, and he decided to temporarily make it his own as long as he was planning on going undercover. His hair grew down to his shoulder blades and twisted and curled into spirals on each side of his head, with carefully trimmed bangs up top.

He saw himself in a mirror and thought he looked adorable… but the clothes had to go. He would never sneak in looking like this. He couldn't take the girl's work uniform, because she needed that. What he could do however, was steal one of the many outfits on display. He found a modest and simple dress that he knew was not for prom but simply for everyday wearing, and swapped it with his shirt and pants.

Suddenly he was wearing a sleeveless knee length dark purple dress that showed off his smooth shaved legs, but hid his lack of cleavage. He grabbed his old clothing off the rack and stuffed it in a shopping bag so no one could see what he was carrying. He did the same with a pair of cute ballet flats that he spotted, and soon they were on his feet as well, and he stuffed his old male shoes in the bag.
11511222.title: James makes a swap that lets him infiltrate the...

115112222.content:
He was much, much more feminine now, but apparently not quite feminine enough to make it into the changing room. He looked at the young clerk once more and decided to swap every last physical element. He liked the feeling of breasts on his chest, especially how they looked in his cute dress. But the feeling between his legs was something else. In fact, he was starting to wonder why he wanted to sneak into the changing room at all anymore.

Yes, his girlfriend was in there, but he realized he didn't have much interest in having a girlfriend at this point. But he was interested in trying on some prom dresses. Maybe he could even wear one around the mall without anyone wondering why...But he couldn't just abandon Lauren, could he? He may not be interested in her anymore, but she was still his girlfriend...right?

James falls in love with a particular Doll
1151122221.content:
James realized what he was thinking. He wasn't interested in Lauren his girlfriend. He would prefer to wear dresses than see girls undressed? James realized that he must have gone too far and swapped back everything he did in the last group of swaps. He didn't know which swap caused a mental change but he knew one of them must have. He was glad he caught it before he got into trouble. He wasn't sure what type of trouble he could get in, but when you aren't thinking right anything could happen.

James decided to wait for Lauren, but after a while he got bored. So he phoned Lauren. "Look I have nothing to do here and they won't let me inside."

"Of course they won't let you in, its the woman's changing room."

"Well I thought you would come out and show me the dresses."

"I wish you could come in."

"I tried that already it didn't work."

"What did you say? You tried to sneak into the women's dressing room? You'd get arrested."

"That wasn't what I meant. But what am I supposed to do?"

"Look, I can't come out after putting on every dress. But I'll narrow it down to three and then show you them to make the final decision."

"When would that be?"

"I don't know, I'll phone you. Why not look around the mall?"

"OK, I'll do that'" James hung up and wandered around the mall. He found himself in a toy store looking at some dolls.
1151122221.title: Wait for Lauren

1151122222.content:
James decided he could always come back for Lauren. After all, he didn't need to waste his own time changing. He used the ring to swap the purple dress he was wearing with a short satin silver dress with matching heels. Yes, he was sure he'd look a little silly running around the mall in an obvious prom dress, but he was perfectly prepared to punish anyone who dared make fun of him.

Upon leaving the store, James knew he should be worried. He could barely muster up any feelings for his girlfriend, though he knew they should be there. He realized he might be making some unintentional mental changes too himself. In fact, looking down at his now fully female body, he knew that being a woman should have made him feel awkward. Instead, it actually felt right and natural. The thought about going back to his own body seemed a little weird and gross now.

While his thoughts were elsewhere, he felt someone bang into him. It was just some teenage punk not looking where he was going. Of course, instead of being forgiving, James was just angry. Still being very close to the dress store, the male punk now walked away in a tight black minidress while his own ripped jeans and flannel shirt adorned a mannequin inside the dress shop. James smiled seeing the punk struggle to walk in 6 inch heels.
1151122222.title: Leave her and go scope out more in the mall

11511222221.content:
James' wondered if mannequins wore underwear, but he assumed they didn't. Up until now that is. James' chuckled to himself. James decided that it would be more fun to do clothes swapping instead of clothes shopping. Again he chuckled at his joke.

Now what am I to swap he thought. He looked around as he passed people. He would think, "how would these two look in each other's clothes." James decided that swapping people's outer clothes would be noticed by everyone. But what if he just swapped their underwear. An older woman's full coverage support bra was swapped with another woman's push up bra. The old woman's sagging breasts looked silly under her blouse supported by the pull-up bra which didn't support much at all. Whereas the younger woman looked even worse when the bright white tops and straps of her support bra showed over the top of her low necked strapless blouse. That was perfect, neither knew anything was wrong and people might talk but no one would think that it was odd enough to confront the women.

James next swapped the underwear of several couples. It was true that he couldn't see the exact changes but he didn't care. He swapped the underwear of two women, and of a woman and her young daughter. Then the underwear of several mixed couples as he passed them. He didn't care if the people were together or if they just happened to be passing each other. But soon James became frustrated that he couldn't see the results of his swaps so he decided to do a more obvious (at least to him) swap.
11511222221.title: Venturing further into the mall.

115113.content:
After dinner was over, James returned to his room to finish decorating his notebook. He wanted to watch something on TV in the livingroom but Audrey and his dad was going to watch some sports crap instead. While drawing his hearts, James got to thinking about Lauren. he decided to call her. He didn't have much to say he just wanted to talk to her.

James liked talking to Lauren, but he rarely called her unless he had something he wanted to tell her. But this time he didn't really have anything to say. He actually had a lot to say but he didn't want to tell her about the ring so he just called to say "Hi."

Lauren got on the phone and they got to talking. In a lot of respects they had more common interests. Some of the things that she used to talk about that James would simply humor her about by saying yeah, and sure seemed to be interesting now that he paid more attention to what she was talking about. In the end, Lauren had convinced James (for the first time) to take her to an art exhibit. James for the first time thought it would be really fun to go.


After the phone call, James went down to talk to his father. "Dad," he said. "I have a date with Lauren on Saturday, can I borrow the car?"

"No, Audrey and I are going to the game on Saturday. You can come along if you like."

James begged and pleaded to get the car on Saturday, but his dad refused. That was until without James knowing it, James swapped his dad's authority with his own. Now when James demanded the car, his dad could not help himself but to give in. When Audrey protested, Nick said don't worry about it. We'll take the bus to the game..
115113.title: Reader's Choice.

choices: James's subconscious swaps something based on his thoughts on the paintings.
They move on to the next room, with more art to inspire him to use the ring.
1151132.content:
James was stunned that his father gave in so easily. All he did was ask a few times and finally he agreed to let James use his car for his date. He didn't think anything of it though, and simply shrugged and went about his day.

The next day went by fairly normally. He managed to go an entire day without accidentally changing himself, or feeling tempted to test out the ring. He was just so excited about his date tomorrow that he could think of nothing else. Normally he wouldn't be this excited, but the idea of an art exhibit just sounded so fun recently. He'd had one of the most interesting chats with Lauren on the phone than he's had in a long time, and he was happy that their relationship had been sparked once again by something he had no idea was so cool.

Things were finally looking up for James, and when Saturday came around, he was thrilled to be going out with Lauren. He had been wearing the ring for a few days now, and nearly forgot it was in the form of the gender neutral bracelet/chain on his wrist. The thing had a habit of slipping his mind it seemed. He was reminded of it when he drove to Lauren's house to pick her up.

"Hey James! Your dad let you borrow the car huh? Moving up in the world!" She teased, and got in the passenger seat. "Oh hey, is that a bracelet? Looks cute on you, nice that you're trying new things."

"Oh yeah, I can't stop wearing it, it's like a good luck charm almost. Things have been going well, and I hope our date today goes even better." He said with a smile.

"Speaking of new things… I'm still surprised you finally agreed to come with me. I always knew you'd like it if you just checked it out. You're gonna love it trust me." Lauren said with a cute smile.

With the windows rolled down, Lauren's jet black hair was fluttering from the wind, and James had to remind himself to keep his eyes on the road, and not get distracted by the beautiful sight sitting there gazing out the window. Lauren was a Korean girl born and raised in this town, and she'd been dating James for 3 years of their high school life. They'd been together longer than most high school couples, and at this point knew almost everything about each other. She didn't look like a model, or was even considered by most people to be beautiful. She dressed plainly and rarely wore makeup, but James saw her through a filter. He saw the girl he loved, and the subtle nuances like how she composed herself, and the serene expressions on her face made him melt into her arms every time.

Now if he had been in his right mind, he might have noticed that he wasn't normally such a romantic. These thoughts were more akin to a 13 year old girl describing her first crush, like a fairy tale romance. But today he was completely giddy to be with Lauren, and wanted to spend as much time with her as possible. It was like he was experiencing dating her for the first time, even though they'd been on countless before.

"Hey James, you going to park? We're here!" Lauren said, as James had kept circling the parking lot for a minute as he daydreamed.

"Oh right…" He said as he snapped out of it.

When they got inside, James was like a little kid again, gazing at all the amazing things. Normally he would have found this dull and uninteresting. But today he looked at the sculptures and paintings, and modern art, and was fascinated by how creative the people who made them must have been.

"You really are into this huh James?" Lauren chuckled, not even believing her eyes. She was happy at least that her boyfriend was enjoying himself. But it was definitely out of character for him.

"Let's look at the classic paintings next ok?" James said excitedly, as he hurried down to the next hall with youthful energy.

Lauren finally caught up with him and saw James staring at detailed paintings of horses running through a field, a beautiful French lady with a parasol kissing a man in a garden, and even some of the more action packed ones like a heroic commander leading troops on horseback in some historic battle. With Audrey's 13 year old girl preferences, James found himself loving all of these. He thought the horses looked so majestic and wished he could ride one with Lauren on their next date.

Then he saw the painting of the French couple and wished he had a relationship as romantic as that. He and Lauren were close but they never did anything lovey dovey. He also found the woman's dress in the painting to be gorgeous and amazingly well detailed. He imagined if the dress were real, if Lauren would want to wear it for him? She never wore dresses or skirts though, so he knew she'd never agree…
1151132.title: At the Art Exhibit

Lauren finishes her painting while James admires her

The two moved onto the next room. This time he decided to stay close to Lauren and hold her in his arms like he saw in the paintings. Lauren enjoyed this new side of James. James had held her before, but it was rare for him to do it in such a public place. but Lauren loved every moment of it.

As they were walking the halls, they saw a young man with an easel coping one of the paintings. James and Lauren admired the man for a while. Lauren said wistfully, "I wish I could paint like that." James made it true. The young man left his painting and decided to look around the museum as he was still an art lover although not an artist anymore. Lauren sat down in his place and continued painting.

"Wow that is great," James said.

"Awe you are just saying that because you are my boyfriend."

"No, I think you really have talent." then James kissed her. The kiss which was really very quick, made James tingle all over. Lauren thought that the kiss was sweet.

What happened next?
11511322.title: They move on to the next room, with more art to...

choices: James is feeling Audrey's personality and is too nervous to undress.
Lauren paints a kinky, but tasteful picture of James and herself naked.
115113221.content:
James sat and admired Lauren as she painted a beautiful rendition of one of the paintings on display. She had always had an interest in art but she never had this kind of real talent before. It used to be limited to drawings of anime characters in her sketchbook, and dreams of becoming a better artist someday. But James felt that he'd just done her a favor and saved her years of art school debt by giving her the talent she needed!

"It's beautiful Lauren, looks even better than the original I'd say." James smiled.

"You think so? I mean… I just finished what that guy was working on and it's just a copy. I didn't really do anything special…" Lauren said shyly.

"It's not just a copy. You put your own talent into it, and I think it's incredible." James said with another quick sweet kiss and then pulled her in close, leaning his head on hers.

Lauren looked down, and then she seemed to get an idea and grinned. She had a funny look in her eyes as she gave him a seductive glance. James knew that look and blushed. Lauren said, "I think we've had enough of the museum today right? Do you … wanna come back to my place? I could pick up some paint supplies and do a picture of you?"

James looked nervous, this was more than he expected from today. "R-really? Why would you want to paint me?"

Lauren giggled, he was being so coy today and she loved it. It was like a new little game for them in her mind. "So I could keep it for myself… you wouldn't have any clothes on of course…"

"N-no clothes? Wow…" James was getting extremely embarrassed now. This was all moving so fast! He now had the relationship experience of a 13 year old girl, and he was feeling like this was his first time ever with someone he crushed on. The years of dating Lauren seemed irrelevant now, it was like all new experiences.

"No clothes… And it's only fair that I don't wear any either, if you aren't." Lauren whispered breathlessly as she kissed James tenderly on the lips.

She loved the way he was blushing and acting so shy. She wasn't used to being the forward one, but was enjoying herself already. With both of them completely in the mood for a good time, they decided to leave the exhibit early, and hurried over to Lauren's house. She had wanted to go to the art store to pick up painting supplies, but James insisted that they go straight home. She expected that he just wanted to skip the painting and go straight to the sex, which she was fine with, but she was shocked to see her bedroom was now stocked with canvas and paints and everything she needed.

"Oh my god! Where did this all come from?!" Lauren gasped as she looked through all the new supplies stacked up in her bedroom.

"It's all for you." James smiled, taking credit for them. In truth he had used the remote to swap ownership of all of the man's painting supplies to Lauren, but he had left her aware so she would have this joy of discovering it. That man wouldn't be needing it anymore anyhow.

"This is amazing how did… oh never mind now we can actually do this! Oh I can't wait…" Lauren sounded giddy as she began setting up her new easel.

Lauren rolled her eyes, "Maybe we made you too convincing. Just make sure not to talk to people, your voice still sounds pretty male… Unless you think you can pull off a girl's voice that doesn't sound too fake?"

She felt like somehow the roles were reversed, and James was acting more like the girl on this 'date' they were having. She didn't feel very feminine today, but she couldn't put her finger on why. She had no idea that James had taken her feminine mannerisms, as well as her small feet. In fact, her feet were now quite disproportionate for her body…

She checked to make sure it wasn't busy first, and there was only one other woman in the stalls, so the coast was mostly clear. She went up to the mirror and got a makeup kit out of her purse, and touched up her lips and eyeliner. Lauren usually wore her makeup in a very natural looking style, but it still kept effort to maintain. She wanted to teach James that even a 'natural' makeup style was a lot of work, even though it didn't look like much.

She handed him the kit, and smiled. "Go on 'Jamie', you don't need my help do you? You're a grown woman!" Lauren teased.

All James had to do was say that to make Eric sigh out of disappointment. "Now here me out," James started to explain why he did it. "It was identities with the mother of my sister's friend. I knew she was going to be at my house again today so it was only for 1 night. I didn't do anything else, I promise." His friend's explanation was acceptable, but he was morbidly curious about something. "Even if you didn't swap anything else, did you actually 'do' anything, if you know what I mean." Eric asked, making air quotes out of habit.

James knew exactly what Eric meant. "No I didn't 'do' anything. Riley's dad only cuddled with me in bed and we watched a couple movies. That's it. Honest truth." James was actually speaking the truth. Jerry had not once come on to him when he was in Margret's place. Jerry and James had only cuddled. (Although James was stilled creeped out about that.) "Good. You didn't cheat on Lauren. At least you have the decency not to do that." Eric said, chuckling. "So. identities, huh? Interesting how that stupid ring of yours just keeps getting weirder."

It took a moment for the realization to hit Eric. "Wait a minute, this means you can make nonphysical swaps to people! Did you know about that?" Eric started to interrogate again. James was in a corner now. Thinking back, maybe calling Eric wasn't the best thing to do. "Yes I knew that. But if you're trying to imply that I used that to swap people's names and stuff, you are wrong! The only time I used it was yesterday, which I already explained." James genuinely sounded like an innocent person trying to defend themself. "Well, James, I can't trust you entirely but as your friend, I'll take your word for it." Eric said. James breathed a sigh of relief, but away from the so Eric couldn't hear. Eric didn't stop talking though. "But just in case James, let me have the TSAR, at least for a day. It'll be good for you. Please." Eric pleaded with James.

Mr. Fletcher resumed the lesson, and James leaned over to the girl sitting next to him (one of his new friends, it turned out), and asked, "Who's the dumbest kid in class?"

The girl replied, "The dumbest? I think it's Todd, over there." She pointed to him, and James followed her finger. Outwardly, he didn't look any different from an average second grader. He was currently staring off into space while Mr. Fletcher was lecturing, but a few other kids were doing that as well. "Are you sure?" James asked the girl. She nodded. "I've been in the same class with him since kindergarten, and he doesn't care about school. I don't think he's learned much." This revelation intrigued James. He had always been very diligent about his schoolwork, and he typically looked down on people who couldn't care less about their education. James was curious about Todd's mentality, and so he decided to swap their intelligence and interest in school. James concentrated, and performed the swap.

James was expecting to feel something, like his brain being sucked out of his head. But he didn't. The swap happened instantly. James was smart, and then he wasn't. He looked down at his "Silent E" worksheet, and he knew his answers were right because he wrote them down when he was smart. But he didn't know why they were right. Now, James didn't see why the word "done" shouldn't be pronounced with the "e" at the end. Not that it mattered, anyway. If James wanted to spell "done," he'd just spell it "don," because that's how people say it. He didn't care if his teacher said it should be spelled a different way. "School is stupid," he said out loud. The James' friend sighed and said "You really need to care more about school. You should be more like Todd."

"But you said he was the dumbest kid in class!"

"No I didn't! He's the smartest! He always does his homework and he cares a lot about school! You're the dumbest, James!"

James became overwhelmed with anger, and he was about to hit the girl when Mr. Fletcher said, "Stop right now!" James and the girl both stared at the teacher. Mr. Fletcher's hands were on his hips, and he had a scowl on his face. "Now, since you've both been behaving very well today, I'm going to let you off with a warning. But if you start arguing again, you will both be joining me after class." After thinking for a second, Mr. Fletcher said, "And I want you both to say something you like about each other. Now."
