choices: Audrey comes home, bringing a friend from her class.
15521121111121111131222221213312222.content:
James knew it would be easy to simply swap ages with Jacob and call it a day, but as a fifth grader with a new friend, the desire to grow up was slightly lessened. He knew Jacob wasn't going anywhere, and there was still plenty of time to swap back later. Plus if he grew up now, he would probably not be friends with Anna anymore, and might not ever see her again. He couldn't just leave such a cool girl behind so easily, could he?

As he debated this, Jacob was quickly disappearing down the street, maybe visiting someone in the neighborhood, or just going out for some exercise, who knew what grownups did? James sure didn't. He sighed and decided to wait for Anna, and headed inside to work on homework. This time however, he had the maturity of a fifth grader, and he knew he wouldn't stay this old for long, so he really didn't give much effort into the homework, just kind of rushing through it. Afterwards, he went to his room (still shared with Audrey) and changed into something more comfortable and casual. A pair of light blue jeans and a white tank top would suffice. James once again noticed the training bra that he had on under his shirt, but left it on cause he wasn't quite sure what to do with it. A part of him thought it was unusual, but when he peeked underneath it, he definitely noticed some puffiness in the area around his nipples, so he supposed it was just something that was necessary.

Then the doorbell rang. James sprang out of his chair and saw through the window that Anna was here. Suddenly he was a nervous wreck. What would she think? Would she criticize James' choice of casual outfit? Would Audrey somehow screw everything up?

It's fine, she's just a friend right? I mean I only met her today... I just can't remember having girl friends over to play before, weren't most of my friends boys? Why am I so nervous about her being here?

Finally he got the courage to open the door. "Anna!"

"Hey Jamie!" She seemed genuinely happy to be here, and even initiated a hug that James wasn't expecting. Something'd definitely changed since he became the same age as her. James thought she was acting like they'd known each other a lot longer than a day.

They spent a moment talking, and were about to head to James' room, but they were stopped by Heather, "Oh hey Anna, Jamie was telling me about you. How long have you been friends?"

"Since this mor-" James started but was interrupted as Anna said, "For a few months."

"Huh?" James looked confused, but no one seemed to notice.

Heather seemed to believe it, "Well that's great! Always nice to have Jamie's friends over. Let me know if you girls want any snacks or drinks, and try not to make a mess!"

"Sure thing mommy!" James said, as he hurried Anna along down towards their room.

When they got inside, Anna didn't seem unimpressed, she stood there and looked around in awe at all of the stuff. "You share this room with your big sis? Wow she has such cool clothes! Does she let you use her old stuff?"

James nodded, "Sometimes, but I've got a lot of my own clothes that I picked out myself. But we share a lot in this room."

"Must be cool to have a big sister, I only have a brother."

"Don't be jealous, trust me, she can be really annoying too. I just hope she is busy today." James said with a sigh.

"Still, you have a way bigger selection of stuff than I do…" Anna began rummaging through your closet. She pulled out a red pleated skirt from the dresser. "This is pretty cute, you should put it on! Or do you want me to?"James felt a little embarrassed at her going through 'his' stuff, which didn't originally belong to him anyways, but was the fifth grade equivalent of the girl's outfit he'd swapped with. Everything was slightly more mature than when he'd originally swapped, but not much had changed in 2 years.

"Wh-why? If you wanna go outside that will get all dirty and stained. I like that skirt…" James wasn't sure why he'd said that last part, but he did.

155211211111211111312222212133122221.content:
"I have a swing set out back. Want to play?" James said.

"Yeah, let's go" It was apretty day the perfect day for playing outside. The two got on adjoining swings and pumped themselves back and forth. After a while James asked, "I am really worried about Kelsie."

"She did seem awfully upset today."

"I know. She seemed scared too. We should check on her."

"I thought you didn't like her."

"I don't. I mean we are friends but you know how she can be."

Anna sighed, "I know."

"But we should go and see how she is doing," James was a good person at heart. He didn't want to hurt anyone, but Kelsie was being mean to him. James didn't want to hurt her too much. After thinking about it for a while James thought that he had gone too far. It was just supposed to be a trick. But when James saw her really crying in Mrs' Dietz body it had gotten to him. James didn't do anything else all day, but what James had done was very mean.

"It's not too late, let's go."

"Mom, I'm going to walk Anna's home," James said.

"Honey be back for dinner."

"OK, I just want to see her house and then, I'll come right back.

Anna and James walked towards Anna house, but then veered to Kelsie's They knocked at the door, Kelsie's mother answered. They asked if they could see her, but her mom said that Kelsie came home from school sick and she was in her room. They should come back tomorrow. There was nothing else to do but continue to Anna's place.

"Wow, Kelsie is sick. She didn't see sick when she got off the bus," Anna said.

James didn't know if it was his fault or if Kelsie had truly gotten sick. There was nothing he could do anyway. The guilt weighed upon James though.

Soon they were at Anna's house and walked in. Anna showed James her room. Anna regretted that she didn't have all the extra girly stuff that James had since James had an older sister not a brother. "I'm sure your brother is nice, can I meet him?"

"Sure he is in his room, I think." Anna escorted James to her brother's room. The room was typical for a fourteen year old boy and her brother seemed just as typical. James wanted to do use the TSAR to do something nice for Anna. A way of making up for the awful thing he had done to Kelsie. This made sense in the logic of a fifth grader.

"Bill, this is Jamie. She's a friend of mine from school."

"Hello, Jamie," the boy said without much enthusiasm.

James needed a female to swap genders with Bill. It didn't matter which one. James knew he couldn't do it with anyone in the house so James asked and he moved to the window, "Does this look over the front lawn?"

"It does. But I'm busy with something. I..." Bill didn't want to seem too rude, but he wanted the girls out of his room. If it was just Anna alone, he would kick her out, but James was a stranger.

James saw a woman in her thirties in the street. James was going to swap genders so it wouldn't matter what the woman's age was. Just now Anna would have a sister which she wanted. James used the TSAR to perform it's magic and the woman was changed.

James was too young to consider what might had happened to the random woman who happened to be walking by Anna's house. The scene didn't change too much. The woman was now a man although he wore similar clothing and much more makeup than before. The woman had been married with two children and she worked in a beauty salon. The TSAR changed her but tried to keep the disruption to her life at a minimum. The woman was now a flaming gay man working at the same salon as before. He and his partner were married. They were among the first to be gay married anywhere. Their two children were adopted. But there were also numerous changes (too numerous to count) in the life's of the newly gay man's family and friends to accommodate the change. James never considered any of these things.

When James turned around to see the room he found that....

James found that he wasn't by the window anymore. He was in the front of the room standing by Anna. Billie's attitude had changed. "So nice to meet you," Billie gushed. Then she approached you and gave you a big hug. James hugged back. Looking over Billie's shoulder he could see the room. It had changed a lot. The walls were still painted white, but there was the slightest of pink tint to the white walls. There were two beds in the room instead of one and both were neatly made. There were pink and pale yellow accents everywhere. There wasn't any clothing on the floor as there was before and on the desk and drawers were cute little lion figurines. Since James hadn't seen anything like that in Anna's room, he assumed that Billie had thing about lions.

On the walls were posters of boy bands and pop-stars. James seemed to remember seeing something similar in Anna's room at least when it came to pop-stars. Even though there wasn't a vanity anywhere it was still a typical girl's room.

The changes were a shock to Anna. She knew what had happened and who had done it.

What happens next?

choices: Anna understands. She wants to have a sister and keep this reality.
15521121111121111131222221213312222131.content:
Anna was more dumbstruck than James was, looking around at the strange alien room, and a girl who was apparently her brother bill, but completely female. The new 'Billie' as she was now called, looked and dressed a little girly, but nowhere near as much as the salon woman she'd acquired her new gender from. She honestly looked like just an average fourteen year old girl, and if James and Anna hadn't known any better, they wouldn't have thought there was anything unusual about her. She had been sitting on her bed with a laptop, doing who knows what until she stood up to hug James. Anna watched this all happen, but tried to keep cool for the moment, so she could figure out what happened.

"So! You two share a room too, just like me and my sis! But yours looks way cleaner than mine!" James said, trying to start conversation with Billie.

"Mhm! Yeah that's Anna's bed over there, and most of her stuff is on that side of the room. The closet is a bit of a mess right now, but we try to keep it organized!" Billie said, giving the grand tour of the bedroom.

Anna had been about to say something when she got a look into the closet. Bill being the older sibling, had the bigger room before, and the bigger closet. Now with two girls sharing the same room, the closet looked no bigger than Anna's old one, but that was only due to the sheer number of things packed in it. It quite resembled Jamie and Audrey's closet, in the way it was all crammed inside. Anna was suddenly in love with this room, the closet, all the new clothes she might inherit. And she didn't know this Billie sister of hers very well yet, but she seemed way cooler than Bill. Bill always would keep to himself and ignore Anna before, but Billie seemed way different. That isn't to say Billie and Anna hadn't fought and had arguments over the years, as any sisters would, but this was a much better start than Bill hiding away in his room alone.

"I... yeah! Yeah this is, my, our room Jamie! What do you t-think?" Anna stammered nervously, still trying not to freak.

"It looks so nice! I'm glad you have a big sister who seems pretty nice!"

"Y-yeah... I'm glad too." Anna looked at Jamie suspiciously. "Alright Bill...ie. We'll go run to the kitchen for some snacks ok?"

"Sure thing Ann!" Billie said with a smile, before she hopped back on her bed and flipped open the laptop again.

----------------------------------

When they were finally out of earshot in the kitchen, James started saying "Wow your sister seems really cool, it's like-"

But Anna grabbed him and pinned him against the wall, a little hard. "What the crap is going on Jamie? You had something to do with this didn't you?" Her eyes darted between paranoid glances at Jamie and looking back fondly at the door to her new bedroom.

"Something to do with what? What are you talking about?" James bluffed. His 11 year old poker face wasn't very good though.

"Hello?! You didn't see my brother suddenly grow boobies and his whole room turn girly in like 2 seconds? Am I losing it or is this really happening?"

James squirmed trying to get out from between Anna and the wall. "Ah, well... I uh... Look Anna I just wanted to help. I thought if you had a sister you'd be happier, and you're my friend so that's what I'm here for!"

Part of him knew he'd only met Anna this morning, but another part of him felt like he really had known her for months. And that was the reality that Anna knew, the one in which 11 year old Jamie and her were close friends, if not almost best friends. She trusted Jamie.

"But you can do that?! Like... change entire people like that? Are you like a witch? Is this like your inviting me to Hogwarts?! Oh my god!" Anna started to get way too excited.

"Shhh keep your voice down! You can't let the muggles hear!" James smirked, "No but seriously, there's no Hogwarts as far as I know, it's just me. And I didn't just change your brother into your sister, I can apparently change reality too. Your parents will hopefully believe Billie has always been a girl. And everyone else!"

"But... how come I know?"

James looked away for a second, and lied, "That's uh, because I wanted you to know. I thought, what's the point of a gift if you don't even know you have it?" In truth, he'd just messed up and accidentally made her aware. It had happened once before in the cafeteria, with far more disastrous results.

"Wow... this is all so crazy..." Anna's imagination was beginning to go wild.

"So... look I'm really sorry, if you're mad, I can try to put it back to normal and all that, but it might take a while-" James stammered a premptive apology.

Anna shook her head, black hair fluttering to the sides. "I'm not mad, I love it." She said simply. She was suddenly so OK with this that it began to scare James. He knew he had to put a limit on this before Anna started asking him to change more stuff.

"Well... whew, I'm glad! I was worried you'd be all mad at me..."

"No no, but ... what were you saying about it might take a while to fix?" Anna seemed a bit worried suddenly.

"Well... you see," James started to come up with a lie, "The magic takes a while to prepare. I can't do it all the time, you'd have to wait at least a few days before I could put your sister back to being your brother. Or... I could just leave her like this if you prefer. She'll be like this forever if you want, it wont take any effort."
15521121111121111131222221213312222131.title: Anna loves what James has done

155211211111211111312222212133122221311.content:
"Look, I have to go," James said truthfully, "Mom said I could come and see your house, but I have to get back for dinner."

Anna had heard James' mom say this so she bid her "Goodby" and walked to to the door. "I'll see you tomorrow on the bus. We'll talk about this then." James left. Anna went back to her room to see what it really was like to have a big sister.

James walked home alone. He had plenty of time to think. James wonder if he screwed everything up. He wasn't sure if he should have let Anna know about the change. James wanted it to be a gift. An anonymous gift was OK, but if gift that no one knows about what's the point. Thinking about it now, maybe he shouldn't have let her know or hadn't done anything at all.

This got James to thinking. "Was Kelsie just sick or was it something else? Did he make Kelsie sick?" James was really mad at Kelsie, but he didn't want to get her really hurt. At first James was just having fun. He was trying to scare her a little, but when she started to cry James wondered if he went too far. He wasn't mature enough to know that type of psychological damage that his 'trick' could cause.

James didn't know it, but if he didn't swap back soon, his old life might be a thing of the passed no matter what he did. With all the changes James had made, reality might not spring into shape the way he remembered it, even if he remembered it as it was. The only way to get things exactly as they were was to undo all the changes. And even then that might not be enough. Kelsie was physically and mentally the 'same' as she was before. There weren't any swaps that to her that weren't reversed. But the horror of all that had happened to her might have scarred her for life. She might worry that at any time, she could be a totally different person. She might lose herself without knowing why and that might undermine her entire ego and emotional structure. If you can't be sure that you are yourself that would lead to horrendous mental stresses.

These were the things that he knew about. There was a woman who was now a gay man so that Anna could have a sister. James didn't even know who this woman was. James could make another random man into a woman to put Bill back to normal. But that would cause other consequences that James didn't even think to consider.

Not to mention the bully who was now two years younger than he should be. Even if James returned to his own age, Jacob would end up two years older than he was. This could effect things too.

On the way home, James wasn't paying attention to the street. Even if he was he probably wouldn't notice that Lauren was in a car with Jacob. Lauren and Jacob were now dating. Jacob liked a girl who always wore skirts and dresses. Lauren wasn't made 'girlier' since she lost her genitals to James. But now that she had a penis it was hard to hide when she wore 'tight' clothing like pants. If she wore a loose fitting skirt or dress, then no one would tell that she had a penis underneath. Lauren hardly even knew James name anymore. To Lauren, James was just a little girl that lived in the neighborhood. James was now no longer an option, so Lauren fell in love with Jacob, who had grown into a handsome man. James memories of Lauren were fading too, now that he had 'friends his own age' to play with.

James completely missed the car driving by containing Jacob and Lauren, who had just recently started dating in this reality. But he wasn't so concerned with that right now as trying to make sure he didn't screw anyone else over. He felt horrible about Kelsie now, if he really did mess her up permanently, that was his own fault. And the woman that lost her gender to Anna's brother, now sister, was likely gone forever. He he knew he could never fix that 100%, even if Anna did want her brother back. But fortunately Anna seemed to like this, and so James accepted that he would leave that situation be.

He got home and his mother greeted him as he came in, "Hey Jamie! How'd visiting your friend go?"

"It was good mommy!" It was a slip of the tongue, still calling her mommy. A lot of the other girls in fifth grade said 'mom' now, and he had to remind himself that 'mommy' made him sound too childish. It was a reminder that he was still younger than he should be. "I met her sister, and saw her house, it was nice!"

"That's good honey, I'm glad you had fun." Heather said as she was half paying attention to a TV show, and half listening to her child.

James headed straight for his room, barging in and jumping onto his twin bed, immediately grabbing a big stuffed rabbit for comfort. He knew he should be older and more mature, but right now he didn't care. He just wanted to hug his bunny and feel better.

"Wow sis, you still hug that thing?" Audrey's voice sounded from the other side of the room. James looked up and noticed her bed was barely out of sight due to a dresser in the way, but she still saw him dive for the bunny. "Aren't you a little old for that?"

James pouted, forgetting that Audrey might be in here... He had just wanted some alone time for a while. "No I'm not too old for it! I'm not old enough yet! If I was I wouldn't be hugging this stupid bunny!"

"Whoa, jeez sis chill out. You get your first period or something?" Audrey teased. A light tapping noise could be heard, as she was texting her friends at blazing speed.

"No! I'm only what... 11?" James said defensively, as if he even knew what a period was... He'd lost that knowledge when he regressed and hadn't yet had 'the talk' with mom. He had just heard the word before and knew it was something bad that happened to Audrey when she reached a certain age.

Audrey shrugged, "Hey, it wouldn't be the first time someone got it young. You could get it next week, you never know!"

"God I wish, at least then I would feel like an adult. I hate being a kid..."

"Seriously? Well periods suck, trust me, but I guess being a kid sucks more. If I had to chose I'd probably stick with periods. Sucks to be you sis. Maybe you should grow up faster or something?" Audrey said, seeming very apathetic of Jamie's childlike complaints.

But to James this is what he needed to hear. He realized he should stop worrying about trying to fix all the other people who he'd randomly targeted before, because there wasn't much he could do for them. Instead he needed to focus on what was most important, returning to his original age!

"That's a great idea sis!" James jumped out of bed and rushed over to Audrey.

"Uh, what?"

"Hold on a sec!" James ran out of the room and looked out the front window towards Jacob's house. There was no car in the driveway, and it seemed like no one was home. "Crap..."

"Jamie?" Heather asked, "Don't go outside, dinner's going to be ready in just a bit. You can play with your friends tomorrow."

"Ugh... there's no time for that mom! I gotta grow up!" James said, hurrying back his bedroom. Heather simply chuckled and went back to preparing dinner and watching her TV show.

"Audrey!" James exclaimed as he came back into the room. "Do you have any friends coming over tonight?"

His hope was, maybe, just maybe he might be able to swap ages with someone slightly older. From there he could step his way up in age swapping with different people without completely regressing one person at once. Otherwise he'd have to wait until Jacob was home, and he had no idea when that would be.

It was strange, he didn't really feel older, but now he was supposedly a mom? As a 13 year old, by now he knew the logistics of where babies came from, and wondered how on earth the TSAR was dealing with him being older than his own son, Jacob. He decided that was a line of thought best not explored, or his head might explode. For now he just had to wait until Jacob got home.

Suddenly he heard a car pull up into the garage, and the door unlocked. James looked up excitedly, wondering if this was finally it? The door opened...

"Jacob, is that you?" James called out from the living room, muting the TV. His voice clearly still sounded like a 13 year old girl's, but he knew no one would care.

But the sound of heavier footsteps made it clear that it was probably not Jacob. "Nope, just me honey." A middle aged man said, as he quickly headed towards the living room and set down his coat on the back of a chair.

The man was tall and had quite an impressive beard, so James assumed correctly that this was Jacob's father. The man probably weighed at least twice as much as James, and when he sat down on the couch, the cushion raised up, causing James to lean into his 'husband'. He put his arm over James's shoulder, and let out a long sigh, he was clearly exhausted. Needless to say, as a teen girl, James was really freaked out about now. He tried to squirm away but the man was quite strong, and didn't seem to even notice his 'wife's uncomfortableness.

"Man what a day... Seriously Tara, Disney channel?" The man said with a hearty chuckle, grabbing the remote and changing it to the news. James also learned that apparently his name was Tara now.

"Yyeah... I mean not all the shows on there are bad. I was just seeing what was on." James said meekly, arms straight to either side, trying not to touch the man.

"Jacob's not home yet?"

"No, I was hoping you knew where he was?"

But the man just laughed again, "Our son is hopefully off becoming a man. Didn't he have a date with that cute girl? Lana was her name? I don't remember."

"A date, really?" James was shocked that Jacob had only been an adult for a few days and already had a date. He had few memories left of his life as an adult, but he couldn't recall going on very many dates.

1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.content:
"A-alright, honey. I'll be right up!" Jamie called back to the man who was currently her husband.

She sighed, relieved that she was finally back to 'normal', but she knew it was going to take some getting used to. Jamie had lost all memory of what it was like to be an 18 year old, so she'd have to start by building new ones. Unfortunately she still had her wifely duties to attend to, and she was mature enough to know what she absolutely DIDN'T want Mr Cooley doing tonight.

Jamie flipped the TV off and headed upstairs to the master bedroom. It was already very late and the lights were all out, with Mr Cooley lying alone on the bed getting comfortable. A part of Jamie was compelled to go through her usual evening routine, washing her face, brushing her teeth, and all that. But she realized that was Tara's evening routine, not hers. She had no intention on staying in this life, and just wanted to get to sleep as fast as possible to wake up early in the morning.

When she sat down on the bed, Jamie started to undress. She noticed the clothes she'd been wearing, which were actually Mrs Cooley's clothes, had noticeably resized to accommodate Jamie's new womanly curves. She wore a sensible v-neck red blouse and a white cami underneath, which did a decent job containing her impressive, but proportional bust. When she took the blouse off over her head, she saw her chest bounce slightly under the camisole, and once that came off, there was a supportive blue bra with a subtle lace trim around the edges. In the dim lighting from outside, she could see long shadows being cast into the depths of her cleavage, and she smiled.

So this is what it's like to be myself again. Being grown up feels quite different.. These idle thoughts crossed her mind as she unhooked her D cup bra, and simply tossed it aside. She felt so relieved to be rid of the constricting underwire, and hoped that her own bras were more comfortable than Tara's...

Finally she squeezed out of Tara's tight fitting jeans, amazed at just how wide her hips were, and how much harder it was to get the jeans off. Puberty had definitely hit Jamie like a ton of bricks, and she had come out very fortunate. She wasn't a super model or anything, but she was certainly nice to look at, and would make some guy or girl very happy. Underneath the jeans were a pair of matching lacy blue bikini panties, which had also belonged to Tara. She decided to just leave these on and throw the rest of the clothes in the laundry basket, instead of on the floor.

Once everything was cleaned up, Jamie crawled into bed and spooned up against her husband, who she still didn't even learn the name of. He still seemed partially awake, and pulled his 18 year old wife closer to his body. She hoped he was too tired to want to do anything, but then suddenly she felt a cold hand cupping one of her bare breasts, softly kneading it, and then letting go. If there was a light on in the room, someone might have seen that under the mess of blonde hair, Jamie's face was bright red. I... wow... I didn't... didn't think that would feel like that. I guess this is what it's like to be a grown woman finally. I mean, I shouldn't feel weird, right, he's my husband for the night. As far as the universe is concerned, it's completely expected that he would... fondle... his wife. Hopefully that's all there is though...

Jamie prayed that her husband was too tired to continue, and she was right. After several minutes passed, and only a few breast fondles, he seemed to be out cold. He must have had a long day.

1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.content:
Jamie blinked and shook her head as the effects of disorientation wore off. After switching back to her real life, she found herself back at home, no longer trying to take the bus. She wasn't in elementary school or middle school, or even a mother, but a normal high school girl at last. This was what she had wanted to return to wasn't it? It must be, since this was the same age that Jacob had been, 18 years old, and a senior in high school. Problem was, Jamie still didn't have many memories of high school left. She remembered a few faces and names here and there, probably friends, but who they were was hazy at best.

She sat at the kitchen table, and realized there was a small breakfast quickly getting cold, so she finished that off and went to her room to see what was different. "Oh my god..." Jamie nearly squealed in giddiness, as she saw how her bedroom had changed.

Still it was shared with Audrey, who was now only 11, but Jamie's side of the room was drastically different. Where it had once been Audrey's boy band posters, amateur makeup kits, and tween clothing. It now looked like she really had grown up. Instead of corny boy band posters, were now more posters of famous movies, video game characters in awesome poses, and even attractive athletes, both male and female. Sports jerseys that said "Barrett" on the back, her last name, hung on the wall. It appeared she played for the girl's soccer team one year, and the volleyball team another year, but she couldn't tell which. It was no wonder she felt so athletic, all these after school sports really get someone in shape over the years. She wondered if this was how she was always like, or if her time building a friendship with Anna had influenced this in any way. There was no way for her to know for sure, but she loved it regardless. It was better than being the scrawny weak little girl that got knocked down trying to kick a ball (what felt like) all those years ago.

But moving on from the wall of sports related things, Jamie finally caught sight of something she hadn't expected: a full blown laptop PC on her desk by the bed. It probably wasn't very high end, but it was hers. She just hoped she knew the password to it. She felt an odd connection to the PC when she looked at it however, as though she had memories associated with it. This was strange, because none of the other things in the room made her feel this way. But she would have to investigate that later, since she had school to get ready for.

She quickly headed towards the bathroom, not sure how much time she had. When Jamie got there she was shocked by the sheer amount of stuff that was on the counter, in the shower, in the medicine cabinet, it was all just full to the brim. As a younger girl she'd never had to use so much stuff in the bathroom, and she realized it might take her some time to learn what it was all for. But luckily today was not that day, since the mirror revealed she was already made up and ready for school! Thankfully her naturally blonde hair was already done, straightened it fell to the small of her back, and styled in the front to have fringe that curled slightly inwards to frame her face. The bangs weren't quite as emo as they were when she was 13, now being cleanly controlled to the side, without covering up her entire eye. Occasionally a bang would fall out of place and obscure her vision, but a simple flick of the head and it obeyed for a while longer. She loved the look so much, she had already forgotten this wasn't even her original hair.

For clothes, she wasn't as dolled up as she expected, but it was just a casual school outfit, not the prom, she reminded herself. She wore a simple violet off the shoulder top which was loose enough around the neck to reveal her entire right shoulder, but everywhere else was nearly form fitting. It showed no cleavage, but the shape of her D cup chest was clearly visible, and it made her smirk when they bounced. She realized she was wearing a strapless bra so you couldn't see it on the revealed shoulder, and it didn't exactly hold them in place all too well. But she found the bouncing effect rather amusing, so she let it slide. Below that she wore a simple pair of grey shorts which revealed a lot of leg, and a pair of barefoot tennis shoes with no socks.

That was when Jamie realized she couldn't stop beaming a smile at the mirror. She worried she had become vain, but it was the reaction of seeing herself grown up for what felt like the first time, and being so happy at the result. It seemed like years had passed since she was just a little girl who wanted to grow up to be pretty like... Lauren? Was that her name? I wonder if that wish came true or not?

Her daydreaming was interrupted by her mother, Heather.
