"Well they do have sports bras you know. Besides it'll be fun. We need one more for the team."

"Who do you have?"

"Well we have Me, Lauren and Jody of course. Then there is Sasha, Bri and Katie."

"That's six, that is all you need."

"We need an alternate. What if someone gets hurt or tired. Or just can't make it to the game. Without an alternate we would forfeit."

"I don't know, I'll think about it."

"You do that."

They finally arrived at school and after parking the three walked towards the school. The conversations continued. Eric seeing his girlfriend from afar ran up to her from behind covered her eyes and said, "Guess who?"

"Ujmmm, Chris Pine?" Kim said. Kim was a big Star Trek fan.

"No, but I will take you where you have never gone before. At least when I get you alone," Eric said.

What happens when Eric sees Jamie?
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.title: Mom reminds her to pick up Lauren on the way to...

choices: Eric shrugs it off for now, and everyone goes about their school day.
Eric seems suspicious, and silently wonders where his friend James is today?
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.content:
Throughout the morning so far Jamie had been running more or less on autopilot. She just tried to go with the flow, learning who were her close friends, and who she had no memory of. Lauren she definitely felt there was a connection there, stronger than everyone else around, stronger than any connection she'd felt yet with anything. But it was frustrating to not be able to remember why. It was almost like she had amnesia, but was just going through life pretending like she knew what was going on. Jamie was smart enough to know that she couldn't keep that up for long, before she was lacking some critical memory of a person very important to her.

Lauren hadn't really said much directly to Jamie today, mostly gushing about her date with Jacob to Kim and Jody, as Jamie drove the car and listened, trying to pick up details. She wondered what would happen now that Jacob was only 13? Why hadn't the TSAR caused her to forget the date ever happened yet? Maybe it wasn't important enough, who knows. But it bugged Jamie as everyone else talked.

With Kim she felt a connection as well, albeit a much weaker one than Lauren's. She felt comfortable around Kim, but only to a point. Howver, with Jody she felt no connection with. It was almost like she'd never met her before... But everyone around seemed to believe that they were all friends together. If everything in Jamie's life had been put back to normal, then why didn't she feel any sort of recognition around Jody? She seemed like a nice girl who would be easy to befriend, but there was nothing there...

"Guess who?" A guy's voice said, as he grabbed Kim from behind. Kim giggled and played along, as this was apparently her boyfriend. They laughed and flirted for a moment, and Jamie caught a glance of the guy's face. Yeah I feel something around him too... I think his name's Eric. Why did I remember his name and not Jody's? I seem to feel like we were very close once...

Jamie started wondering why she felt closer to Kim's boyfriend and not to Kim. A part of her suspected that she might actually have feelings for this Eric guy. He was cute after all, and she could see herself dating him. But she could also see herself dating Kim, or Lauren even. This in itself startled her, since as a girl it never occurred to her that she might be bisexual, but now that she was grown up again, it didn't seem that far fetched anymore.

"So are you going to introduce me to your new friend?" Eric asked Kim, while looking curiously at Jamie.

Kim gave a confused laugh, "New friend? Uhh who's that?"

"The... other blonde one?" He pointed towards Jamie. "I'm not seeing double today am I?"

He was referring to Kim, since she had blonde hair as well, though it was shorter and in a ponytail, as opposed to Jamie's longer, carefully styled approach. Kim was looking really confused now, and was about to answer, but Jamie decided to save her the trouble.

"Hey! I'm Jamie, nice to meet you! I'm gonna play as an alternate on Kim's volleyball team soon." Jamie blurted out, having apparently come to a decision. She remembered seeing the volleyball jersey in her bedroom, so she knew at some point in the past she had been on a team. She was confident the skills to play would come naturally!

"Really?! Yes thank you Jamie! I know you haven't played since sophomore year, but I'm sure you'll be our ringer, you've still got it!" Kim seemed delighted to hear Jamie's choice, but then she furrowed her brow. "But come on, you've met Eric before, haven't you? I could have sworn Eric was around last time we all hung out together?"

Jamie looked at Eric, who simply shrugged. She wasn't sure what was going on, but since Eric seemed to have no idea, Jamie decided to go along with him. "No, I mean, I've heard you talk about him plenty of times of course, but I think this is the first time we've talked!"

Eric nodded, "Come on Kim, I'm sure I would remember a nice girl like this. Anyway, it's nice to meet you uh... Jamie. You seem familiar but... well maybe we were at the same party and passed by without talking, I don't know."

She really found it strange how he seemed so unsure of himself now. First he was insistent he hadn't met Jamie, but after a minute or so, he said she looked familiar? And Jamie still had the feeling that she did know him from somewhere, quite well. Something was definitely unusual, and Jamie's worry fell to the TSAR. If it had somehow screwed up this Eric guy... that could turn out to be a mess after all.
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.title: Eric asks who is the new girl?

choices: Jamie resolves to make Anna eighteen
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.content:
The group broke up to head to their own classes. Jamie's first class was math. She got to class early and took out her phone. She found her Facebook account and started reading. She had over a thousand friends. Jamie discovered she was a social butterfly on the internet. But to Jamie she didn't feel like she was discovering it, it felt more like reminding herself of something that had always been. She read the first few messages and felt like she had to post replies to several. Then she realized, that it wasn't only Facebook that she did everyday, but Twitter, Instagram and Pinterest. On-line she knew everyone and everyone knew her. Each post reminded her of another friend. In fact it reminded her of the people in the class she was actually sitting in. She looked around and saw, Tom, Alice, Jarred, Ed and the people she knew. Some were real friends, some were just on-line friends but it made the casual 'hi's more intimate than it would otherwise be. James had never been this popular on-line, but it seems the 'new' Jamie knew everyone and she liked it.

Jamie's grades were also well above what James had been. In fact, since this was her senior year and had done so well in the lower grades, she didn't have a full schedule anymore. She didn't need it to graduate. She only had five regular classes and a study hall. This gave her time for all her online social networking. Today, she would even have to stay an extra period after her classes were done just to drive Lauren and the gang back home. This is why, Jamie wasn't usually in the early morning carpool.

Third period was study hall for Jamie. Jamie used the time to read the Facebook posts, the Tweets, the Pinterest pictures and the Instagram stuff. By the time the period was over, Jamie had remembered her entire life before using the TSAR. All-in-all Jamie loved her life. She wouldn't want to change it. She even wondered why she would try that age change experiment with the TSAR. It was just the TSAR was new and she wanted to try it out. But if anything had screwed her happy life she could never forgive herself.

But one thing she wouldn't regret was her time with Anna. Anna was a great person and Jamie wished she was still her friend. Jamie wished that Anna would still be her friend, but that could only happen if they were the same age. Jamie could never be eleven again. That was his sister's age. But maybe Anna could be changed to be eighteen. That would be great. Anna could be friends with everyone: Lauren, Kim, Jody, Sasha, Bri, Katie, everyone. They would all love her just like Jamie did. Jamie remembered that Anna was her sister Audrey's friend. Jamie didn't know why she had grown so close to Anna so fast, but she did. She wondered if Anna had a Facebook account so she could see how Anna was doing. But she didn't think so, Anna was only eleven.
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.title: Eric shrugs it off for now, and everyone goes a...

choices: After school, informal volleyball meetup with Kim, Lauren, and the rest.
Jamie finds another candidate for 'age donor' in class.
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.content:
I can't just leave Anna behind as a kid... We had such fun together and got along so well, it would be a shame for her to never really know that friendship we had. Jamie was determined to make Anna the same age as her, but she just needed time to think how she could do it. Clearly she would have to find an 18 year old and swap their age with Anna's. But Jamie knew her powers only seemed to work when she could see someone, so they'd both have to be in the same place. There was the option of using herself as a go-between during the swap, but she honestly didn't want to touch her own age anymore, and possibly risk changing anything about her life. No, that was way too risky, and she knew it.

During her study period, she finally caught up on most of her social media updates, and reminded herself that she could use some of this time to get a head start on her math homework. She had to get used to getting back in the swing of things, since the past few days she didn't have to worry one bit about homework. But back in her real life, her grades were real and mattered, and she didn't want to ruin her GPA so close to graduation. So for the next 20 minutes she flew through the homework assignment from math. The knowledge from the class came quickly to her, and it felt nice to not have to stress over it too much.

In between math problems, she looked around at some of the other students in study hall. She knew most of their faces, but didn't really feel a connection with any of them. They weren't true friends like Lauren and Kim, but just acquaintances. Yet when she saw someone like the boy the next table over, she knew his name was Rob, and she knew that he had an eerily similar schedule to hers. They always ended up in the same classes every year, probably by pure chance, but the two never hit it off. He was quiet and kept to his studies, but she remembered catching him steal glances her way now and then. It was flattering, and she decided to leave him be. Someone else in the room was a girl named Becky. For some reason she had taken study hall, but never actually studied. The difference between her and Jamie, was that Becky actually needed to study. She was on the hairy edge of failing half of her classes, and was considering dropping out of school entirely. Jamie knew this simply from seeing her face and remembering reading her Facebook updates once or twice. She did seem to stress over school a lot, but didn't have the drive to fix her habits.

That girl definitely needs a few extra years to sort her life out. Seems like life has caught up with her quicker than she expected. Wonder what the consequences of making her 11 years old would be? If anything it'd give her a second chance at school all over again. And if swapping ages with Jacob was any indication, she would still keep her same personality and identity as she does now, but she'd just get a chance to live her teens all over again. Jamie wondered, but then considered that Becky might make all the same mistakes over again if given the opportunity.

Jamie just made a mental note to consider Becky as someone who might be a swap target for Anna. Finally study period was over however, and people casually started to file out of the room and chitchat in the halls. Jamie caught up with Becky before she ran off to wherever. Becky was dressed plainly in a simple pair of ragged jeans and flip flops, and a rock band T-shirt. She had plain brown hair that was straightened but clearly not maintained frequently. Jamie could tell just by her appearance that she didn't really come from privilege...

"Hey! Becky right?" Jamie greeted her with an approachable smile that seemed to come natural.

"Oh, hi there, Jamie. What's going on?" Becky seemed a bit surprised to be spoken to so suddenly, but went along with talking while walking.

"Well uhh," Jamie started in a lower volume voice, "I heard you were looking for a math tutor?"

Becky stopped and looked puzzled at Jamie, "No, not really. I mean, I wouldn't be able to pay for one. And who told you that?"

"No one, but listen I could tutor you this weekend for free. A few of us are getting a study group together, and we're gonna help people with the stuff they're stuck on. And it's not one of those lame study groups that says they're going to study and then just messes around. We really want to get everyone prepared for the test. And then party after we all pass!"

The brunette looked at her suspiciously, "I don't know, I mean what's the big deal if I pass a test anyways? I'd still probably fail the class. And why are you doing this for free, you trying to run for student president or something? I bet you'd win no problem, everyone loves you huh?"

Jamie sighed, "Not really... It's just... Nevermind, just let me know if you want to come or not. I'm going to be at volleyball today after school so, you know, I might be busy, but I'll see your message!"

And with that Jamie felt she'd overstayed her welcome, and they went their separate ways to their next respective classes. The whole way, Jamie was buried in her phone, responding to texts and tweets, amazed that she hadn't walked into a wall or a person yet. Yet, as she handled her social life, she still couldn't stop working on trying to find a possible age donor for Anna. Becky seemed like a good candidate, but she might not even show up for the opportunity to swap.
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.title: Jamie resolves to make Anna eighteen

choices: Jamie hints at the power of the TSAR
Maybe volleyball isn't Jamie's sport (TSAR to the rescue)
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.content:
Jamie's school day was over, but she had to wait for her friends classes to end. Having nothing better to do, Jamie decided to take a few selfies of herself in front of the school. She looked at herself through the screen on her iPhone and decided she needed to freshen her makeup. New lipstick, touching up her eye shadow and reapplying her blush was in order. Then she took her hair of of it's ponytail for the picture, left the school and then positioned herself so she was in front of the school doors and took several pictures of herself in several poses. She decided which were the best and then posted them on several social media sites such as Facebook, Pinterest and Instragram each with the caption of "I'm Back!!!" This was an inside joke for her, since no one knew that she had been gone for three days on that magic adventure through time. The memories of exactly what happened were fading fast.

For the first few jumps in age regression, James didn't make any impact on the world in general or the school. Actually there weren't any changes to the high school at all. James (as he throught of himself back then) didn't use the TSAR again while he was regressing thought high school but when he reached middle school and his maturity and self-control diminished he started to use the TSAR to make changes and those changes had indeed changed some of the events and people who had been in the middle school. There was now a teacher in middle school who had almost no self-confidence and a little girl who had it in abundance. The teacher's life had been changed profoundly. With out the self confidence of an adult, he married a different type of person that he had before meeting James. He needed a woman who would take charge of his life and so his life had changed in many ways. The little girl with the confidence of an adult would rise to the top of popularity in the middle school and beyond.

In the sixth grade the lives of a teacher and a student who had swapped ages and positions within the class cause ripples that totally changed both their families although inside the school not too much had changed.

The incident with the lunch lady and little boy in the grammar school was set right by James using the TSAR to fix things. Which was a good thing since it avoided a lawsuit that no one could have predicted the outcome. Whereas in the fourth grade, the personal styles of many students were changes. That didn't make too much of a difference, although there was one boy and one girl who ended up wearing 'unisex' clothing of the other. The boy now wore panties all the time and the girl liked underroos not that the casual observer could tell. But there were occasions that the boy wore a skirt and that girl never wore a dress nor a skirt again. The girl with the lovely blonde hair had to put up with James' hair although she did grow it out eventually. There were also changes in the lower grades that James wasn't aware of and that James now didn't rem,ember now either since he had a lower attention span when he was 'just a kid' of nine or ten. But what James always remembered was his friendship with Anna who took him in when he was a stranger in a younger class. He would never forget what she did for him. Even when he had already forgotten that he had been a him at one time and now she was a she forever...unless she used the TSAR to change it.

Jamie got several replies from his social media friends asking "What do you mean you're back?" James didn't have time to reply because class was over and Kim and company had come to fetch him up for volleyball practice.

What happens next?
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.title: After school, informal volleyball meetup with K...

choices: The game ends with no more swaps.
Jamie can't help it and makes another swap during the game, which Eric notices.
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.content:
After school was finally out, Jamie headed out to the school's volleyball court to meet up with the rest of the ladies who wanted to play. Several of the girls were actually on the school's varsity team, and were just looking for a fun game to practice. But Jamie, Lauren, and Katie were just friends who were invited to come along and participate. Kim, Jody, Bri, and Sasha were all pretty good players, so they decided to break it up into 2v2 varsity players, and then each team would get a third lesser experienced player to round out the 3v3 match. With seven ladies total, it meant that you'd have to sit out a few games until one of them needed to drop out.

You sat on the bench, along with several spectators who were mostly just friends, or the boyfriends of the girls playing. Eric was actually there, watching his girlfriend Kim kick some ass. However, Kim's team along with Jody and Lauren, were not doing so well... Lauren in particular seemed very uncomfortable with the whole thing. She was the only player who insisted on not changing clothes, and was wearing a knee length skirt that she'd worn to school that day. Every time she had to jump to hit the ball, her skirt would encumber her, and she was already short, so she would tend to miss the ball completely...

"It's alright Lauren, just hang in there, we still have this!" Kim yelled encouragement as she dove to return a serve.

The return was good, but a few moments later the ball headed Lauren's way and she completely wiffed, letting the ball sail past. "Ah... Dammit I'm really sorry guys. I think I'm done for the day, this is just not my thing."

Lauren straightened out her skirt and headed over towards the bench where Jamie sat. "Well now's your chance Jamie, if you want to go save the game." Lauren said with a smile, sitting down next to her. She put her arm on Jamie's opposite shoulder, in a friendly hug gesture. "I'm sure you'll be better than me anyways, at least you're dressed for it!"

She was right, Jamie had changed into a pair of shorts and a tank top, and was ready to jump in there. "You sell yourself short Laur, you did your best! I would say you're a brave girl risking ruining that adorable skirt, braver than I am that's for sure!"

Jamie winked at Lauren before getting up to head onto the court. The last thing she did was tie her blonde hair up in a long ponytail, using a scrunchie from her pocket, "Alright, it's been a while let's see how this goes..."

The first set went fairly well, as Jamie got warmed up and memories of playing volleyball in the past started to trickle up to the surface. She was never a star player by any means, but she remembered the basics. Kim, Jody, and Jamie actually ended up winning the first set, just barely!

"Alright, now we're not going to go easy on you guys, let's go!" Sasha yelled from across the court.

The second set started off blazingly fast, and Jamie was starting to have trouble keeping up. Her team relied on her to save the right corner a few times, and she just couldn't predict where it was going to land next. It had been a few years since she last played, and these girls were seasoned varsity players! The second set was a complete disaster, and if they lost one more, the match would be done. Jamie was running out of breath, and simply unable to read these girls as they kept getting the best of her. She needed to level the playing field...

Looking down at her hand, she saw the black ring TSAR on her finger, and briefly focused on Brii's skill at volleyball. Jamie swapped their skills, but focused on not swapping Brii's status off the team. She knew that Brii could take these skills and build herself back up to where she was, but Jamie needed those skills this minute! The third set started, and Jamie started seeing the game in a whole new light. Suddenly she was making jumps she didn't know she was capable of making, leaping for long shots in the corners, and making close saves. She had a much better sense of the other team's tactics, and where the ball would end up now. Before long, Jamie's team pulled out a close victory in the third set! Now they decided to do one last set as a tie breaker, and then call it a day.
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.title: Maybe volleyball isn't Jamie's sport (T...

1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.content:
Jamie had a great deal of fun playing volleyball, but she felt bad for Bri who she swapped her skills with. Bri was in varsity and it wouldn't be fair for Bri to have to 'get good' again. Especially since she was a senior and how she played her last year was what she would remember. Not to mention what if Bri wanted a scholarship for college. It wouldn't be fair to her. Jamie decided when the match was over to return Bri's skills back. Jamie thought that she could swap it back just when she needed it.

After Jamie drove everyone home, she decided to return to her social media exploration. She wasn't sure of everybody and wanted to read up on them. She looked at post after post. Then she went to the actual timelines of the people to read up more about them to 'remind' herself of her friends. It was on one such excursion that Jamie ran across a guy at her school named Jeff Dean. Jamie found the man gorgeous and funny, she liked him a lot instantly. The more she saw of him the more she liked. The only problem was that he was in a relationship with Alicia Hiltrand. According to both their timelines they had been dating for over five months. Jamie wished that she was 'In A Relationship" with Jeff. She was eighteen years old a senior in high school, she wanted to have a boyfriend. There were lots of dances, picnics, the prom and of course graduation where she would be alone if she didn't have a boyfriend. But this great guy was taken. It made her envious.

Jamie noticed on Alicia's timeline that she had posted where she was going to be tonight, Jamie decided to go and see her. Jamie got appropriately dressed, got into her car and drove to the spot. There she searched for Alicia. She knew that it was an event that Jeff wasn't going to be at. When she saw her, she swapped her relationship with Jeff with Alicia's. Instantly without Jamie doing anything, Jamie's status on Facebook was changed to "In A Relationship." Many pictures were added to her photo album showing her with her boyfriend Jeff. Jeff's phone number appeared on Jamie's contact list on her phone. With her work done, without saying anything to anyone, particularly Alicia, Jamie left to return home.

As soon as she was alone, Jamie phoned Jeff.

"Hi, snuggle bunny," Jamie said coyly.

"Hi, honey."

":I just called to hear your voice," which was true.

"I always love hearing from you." The two made the small talk that lovers make. They talked fore over a half an hour really saying nothing. Jamie then got back in her car and drove home after arranging to see Jeff tomorrow after school.

Then Jamie phoned Kim to tell her she couldn't play volleyball. That she just didn't have time, because of Jeff and all. Kim knew that Jamie had been seeing Jeff for several months and understood. Jamie apologized, but she said that she would find someone to take her place.

That someone was going to be Anna as Anna was progressed from eleven years old to eighteen. It wouldn't be hard to progress Anna once she found someone to regress in her stead. Jamie knew that Anna was good friends with her sister Audrey and so she would see her all the time. Jamie would just have to decide who she was going to make eleven again.

What happens next?
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.title: The game ends with one last swap.

choices: Swap Becky and Anna's ages before she gets suspicious about lack of studying...
Jeff starts to get really annoying, and Jamie considers using the TSAR on him...
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.content:
Jamie checked her phone again, and noticed that she had a message from someone she hadn't had a conversation with on her phone before... it was Becky. She sent a Facebook message asking about the tutoring, and if it was still going to happen. She seemed interested after all, but Jamie knew that no amount of last minute studying was going to save Becky's grades before graduation. She was already long past saving that... And that was why she was the best candidate Jamie found so far for an age swap for Anna.

"Yeah, you should come to my place after school tomorrow. If no one else shows up I'll still help you." Jamie sent back in a text reply.

Jamie grinned as her plan was finally coming together. She had a boyfriend finally, and her friend Anna would finally be back! Of course she had no idea if Anna was any good at volleyball, but Jamie had a feeling she'd be good at some kind of sport at the very least.

As she sat at her desk with her laptop, she continued browsing through her many friends online, and checking out people's Instagram photos. She checked out her own, and noticed... it was incredibly full of photos. She had taken a selfie probably every day of high school, and many of those recent ones included Jeff and her making cute lovey faces together. There was one of them on the beach with Jamie in a very revealing bikini, and Jeff looking very nice with just swim shorts on. Jamie felt a little ashamed of herself... for the stupid duck face she did with her lips in some of these, and realized that was out of fashion now, everyone hated that. She resolved to stop making that face in selfies from now on.

--------------------------

The door opened and Audrey wandered into the room, flopping down on the bed. She looked over at Jamie and mumbled, "Hey sis... you doing anything fun?"

"Not right this minute, but how'd you like to hang out with some of my high school friends tomorrow? Jeff's going to be here, and at least another person." Jamie said, smiling at her little sister. She had a sudden memory of how little Audrey always loved when Jeff was over, since the two of them got along great together. Jeff was kind of a kid at heart.

Audrey's eyes lit up at the offer, "What? No way? Here? Why do you want me to hang out anyway?" Audrey suddenly grew suspicious.

"Well it's not a party or anything, we're just gonna hang out and maybe play some games." Jamie lied, knowing exactly how to string her sister along. "But... you are gonna need to bring Anna over too. I really want Anna to be there, ok?"

Audrey thought for a minute, "Anna? Alright sure, I can ask if she can come I guess... But why?"

"Cause you two are like, super good friends right? I wouldn't want to leave your friend out of the fun we're going to have! Jeff might even sneak in some alcohol from his parents and I'll let you have a taste!"

Audrey was just a kid, but she knew that drinking was this super mysterious and supposedly fun thing that only the really cool kids could say they've done. She wanted to be able to brag to her friends that she'd tried it. "Sure thing! Anna and I will be there!"

With that settled, Jamie decided to invite over some of her other friends, and Lauren was the first on her list. This really was quickly turning into a party even though she hadn't planned on this many people showing up. But it was going to be far easier to rationalize it to everyone, if there were more people hanging out. If only one person showed up, it might be suspicious...

--------------------------------

The next school day went by like a breeze. Jamie flew through her classes, and spent most of her off time networking and tracking her friends whereabouts on social media. She knew Jeff would be over tonight, and Becky had said she was definitely looking forward to studying. Lauren was for sure coming, and Kim was a maybe, depending on her schedule. Audrey hadn't yet answered back about whether Anna could be there, and that concerned Jamie. The whole point of orchestrating this was all for Anna... and if she couldn't come, what was the point?

It was the last period of the day, and she was considering postponing the whole event if Anna wasn't coming. She had already started working through in her head what excuses she could give Becky and Lauren and the rest. Her final class got out finally, and she quickly drove home, staring at her phone in case of a message from Audrey, the whole time. Finally as she was about to call the whole thing off, with only an hour left before it started, Audrey burst in the front door.

"Hey sis I'm home!" Audrey called out, and headed for the bedroom. Jamie was the only one home at the moment and she rushed out to meet her.

"Audrey, you didn't answer a single one of my messages all day, what-" Jamie was freaking out, but then behind Audrey, she saw the little 11 year old, tan skinned girl with black hair, Anna.

"Uh, hello? I don't have a phone sis, how did you expect me to get your messages while I was at school, what's the big deal?" Audrey replied while rolling her eyes.

But Jamie was already ignoring Audrey, and greeting Anna, "Hey Anna! Good to see you again! Glad you could make it!"

It was like seeing an old friend again, but this time Anna didn't really react quite how she'd hoped. She still had memory of Jamie changing her brother into her sister, but in this reality Jamie had been the 18 year old sister of her friend Audrey, and they weren't all that close. She smiled politely, but was still a bit unsure of why she was here. "Hey Jamie... yeah, Audrey said I should come hang out today. What's... what's going on? Is this about my sister again?"

"Nope, this is going to be way better than that. I'm having some of my friends over today, and we're gonna hang out and maybe get a liiiitle crazy, but just a little tiny bit." Jamie held up her fingers indicating the tiny amount of crazy they would be getting. "I thought you girls would enjoy hanging out with the big kids."

While normally Audrey was very apathetic about her older sister, today Jamie as her idol. She finally got to feel like she was growing up, and her sister was being really cool for once!

A short time later, Jamie's friends started appearing, Jeff, Becky, Lauren, and even Jody stopped by. Kim couldn't make it, as expected, but it was certainly enough people for a fun night together...
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.title: Jamie works on Anna becoming 18

choices: Anna realized she didn't know anyone at the party
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.content:
Unintentionally a whole party had started. People invited friends, the friends invited their dates, strangers heard about the party and soon the house was full of people. There was music, alcohol. Someone sent out for chips and stuff. Pizzas were delivered it was really getting out of hand. You apologized to Becky saying that this wasn't what you intended and that you would tutor her another time. Becky who was a party girl (in the good sense of the word) didn't mind too much. She loved a good party.

This gave you time to worry about something that had been bothering you. You wondered if you should tell Anna about making her eighteen or do it without her knowledge. If you told her and she said no, you couldn't do it. But then she wouldn't know what she was missing. You knew how much better it was to an an 'adult' you had just gone through year nine years in a day and being eighteen was much more fun. At this age you were nearing the end of puberty. You could drive. College was a stones throw away. But were you robbing her of her childhood.

You decided to spend some time with Anna before progressing her. You didn't think she should tell her. You maneuvered yourself to chat with Anna. Anna was with Audrey. But Anna and Audrey weren't alone. When Audrey found out you were having a party and 'she was invited' she and Anna called Kelsie.

"Who is this?" Jamie asked although she knew exactly who it was.

"This is one of my friends, Kelsie. She has been feeling very down lately."

"So?"

"So I thought a party would pick her up."

"This isn't a party!"

"Looks like a party to me."

"You know what I mean. I mean it's not a party for kids."

"Then why did you invite us?"

"I uh, I mean, I thought you would..." Jamie was at a loss for words. What could she say?"

"Then Kelsie could stay?"

"Oh sure." Jamie was intrigued about Kelsie. Jamie sort of thought that when she returned to normal that everything would be fine with her. Jamie was dying to know. Maybe she was depressed for another reason. Not for what she had done. But that could wait, Jamie had to swap ages of Anna and Becky. Jamie saw Becky enjoying herself in the party and then swapped Anna's age with hers. After the swap, Becky found herself with a bunch of people much older than herself and began to feel self conscious. She spotted Audrey and Kelsie and instinctively joined the people at the party who were her age. All was going smoothly at least for the moment until...
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.title: Swap Becky and Anna's ages before she gets ...

choices: She lets Anna and Lauren up to Jamie's room to talk for a bit.
Everyone has to go, and Jamie is left alone to brood.
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.content:
Jamie heard the garage door opening, and knew that could only mean her parents were home! Quickly she hid the alcohol, grateful that there was so little of it, and the party had only barely started so people were barely even rowdy yet.

"Guys my parents are home, we're gonna have to-" Jamie started, but she stopped as the door opened and her parents stepped into the house.

"What the hell is this?" Jamie's dad, Nick yelled out, coming in to his kitchen to see nearly a dozen teenagers in his house, and even some of Audrey's friends.

"Look dad I can explain, this wasn't-" Jamie tried, but this time her father cut her off.

"You can explain later, first everyone needs to leave, go on, get out! There's way too many people here! This is very unlike you Jamie, why would you do this?" Nick seemed almost hurt that Jamie would betray his trust like that.

Jeff, Jamie's current boyfriend, "Hey let's ditch this place everyone, I know a place we can have some real fun, cmon!"

A few of the people who had shown up just for a party all followed Jeff out the door. The 11 year olds, Anna and Lauren were all who were left, and they looked unsure of whether they should go too or not. Meanwhile Jamie looked heartbroken that Jeff would just ditch so easily like that, and take the party somewhere else without even a goodbye. They were in a relationship weren't they? Did he even care about his girlfriend?

Jamie suddenly felt an unprovoked flood of tears start to leak out, and she hid her face with one arm. "Dammit! Dad this was supposed to be a small thing but... Jeff and... I don't know, they figured it was a party and invited a bunch... Look I don't even care about it anymore, I'll be in my room..."

"Hey! Jamie get back here!" Nick called out to his daughter, but she just stormed upstairs, ignoring him. Heather put her hand on his shoulder and shook her head, hinting that he should leave it be.

The remaining people watched quietly as Jamie quickly retreated upstairs. Audrey and her friends Becky and Kelsie, all looked at each other and shrugged. Audrey stood up and went up to her dad, "Since everyone else is leaving, can we head over to Kelsie's house tonight? I'm really not even sure why Jamie decided to have a party on the same day we were all supposed to play here..."

Nick had his hand on his forehead, and simply waved them off, "Sure fine, just as long as it's not here... Make sure you get back before dinner at least."

Heather approached Anna and Lauren, the only two of Jamie's friends who had stuck around, they stood near the front door, quietly discussing what they should do. Heather quietly told them, "I don't know what is going on here, but Jamie's dad is just really upset right now and it's probably best if you two come back another time."

But Lauren stepped forward, "But... Look around, the party is gone, we weren't even here for a party. Jamie just told us it'd be a small little get together. Our best friend is up there crying her eyes out right now, I think we should go talk to her at least... With your permission Mrs Barrett."
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.title: Jamie's parents got home

choices: Jamie swap Jeff and Alicia's feeling with each other
Jamie leaves quietly and learns a valuable lesson about swapping
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.content:
Anna and Lauren came up to Jamie's room. They saw her on her bed laying face down and crying. Both Lauren and Anna sat on Jamie's bed to comfort her. They patted her shoulder and rubbed her back.

"Honey, Honey, It'll be all right," Anna said. She knew she had to say something although no words would help very much. Jamie continued to cry. Her friends continued to soothe her.

"I thought he loved me," Jamie said weeping. The betrayal of Jeff hurt Jamie so hard because she felt like she had been in a relationship with him for several months, when in reality she had been in a relationship for about a day. Alicia wasn't as strong willed as Jamie was. She was so happy to have a boyfriend that she put up with all the shananagins that Jamie just couldn't live with.

No matter what Jeff did Alicia would eventually forgive him. Sometimes, Jeff would convince Alicia that it was her fault. But Jamie was a more secure person and so her sadness eventually changed to anger and then to rage. But Jamie decided that unlike Alicia it was her fault. Alicia thought that she loved Jeff, but that really wasn't the relationship at all. The relationship wasn't really love, it was more like codependence. Alicia needed a man her life to validate her own worth. Jeff on the other hand was so self-centered that he felt like he deserved to have a girl. Alicia would do anything that he said and never complain no matter how much he hurt her. This relationship worked for him.

Jamie shouldn't be in this relationship at all, it really belonged to Alicia and she was going to give it back to her. This is what calmed her,

Anna and Lauren saw that their concern was working and suggested they have some ice cream to brighten their spirits. Dinner would be ready soon, but when Anna talked to Heather and explained what had happened, Heather relented about having ice cream so close to dinner. Jamie was eighteen and it didn't really matter too much. Little kids would eat ice cream all day, but that wasn't a problem with Jamie who wanted to keep her figure. Lauren could eat as much as she liked, since she burned it off playing Volleyball. Anna had to watch what she ate, but she would treat herself to a little ice cream too. Soon the topic was changed from Jeff to the usual gossip and Jamie's spirits lifted.

A couple days later, Jeff phoned Jamie. He acted as if nothing had happened. He didn't know how he had hurt her. he was a self-centered creep as it turned out. Jamie couldn't understand how someone could put up with a guy like this. Jamie decided that if Alicia could put up with Jeff then she can have him back. Alicia wouldn't even know that she had ever lost him in the first place. Jamie did what she did before to get Jeff and looked through Alicia's Facebook posts to find out where she would be. Jamie made sure to arrange not only for herself but Jeff to be there. She wanted Jeff there when she gave him back to Alicia like an unwanted puppy. This would make Jamie feel good. It would feel like she could just give him away like he meant nothing to her.

A time and a place was set and when Jeff and Jamie got there Alicia was there just as expected. Jamie swapped her relationship with Jeff back to Alicia. "Good Riddens" she thought. Alicia being and insecure emotionally needy person, immediately found Jeff and snuggled protectively under his shoulder. It looked sweet, but it was in reality a toxic relationship.

What happens next?
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.title: She lets Anna and Lauren up to Jamie's room...

choices: Jamie tries to convince Anna to join the volleyball team to help Kim.
Anna promises to help Jamie find a date the old fashioned way.
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.content:
But that wasn't enough for Jamie. She was still sour from the way she perceived Jeff treating her the night before, and wondered how his relationship with Alicia would fare if the roles were reversed. With little hesitation, she swapped Jeff and Alicia's entire personalities. Alicia was now a bit uncaring and self centered, and only was in a relationship with Jeff because she felt like it was a status symbol. And Jeff now was very insecure about his identity, and felt that he needed a girlfriend like Alicia to validate himself socially with everyone around him.

But it wasn't just their relationship that was changed, but their entire personalities. Their clothing preferences, favorite foods, favorite movies, and the way they carried themselves and spoke, were all swapped with eachother. Jeff now wore tight skinny jeans with rolled up cuffs above the ankles, and a pair of purple not so masculine sandals. He wore a button up white shirt with the top two buttons undone, and nothing underneath, but no curves to provide any sort of cleavage that might look good with that outfit.

Alicia on the other hand was wearing loose cargo pants and sneakers, and a plain black T-Shirt over a tank top. Her hair was a total mess, like she just rolled out of bed and didn't use a single product in it, despite it being as long as before. On the other hand, Jeff's hair looked like he just got back from a salon, where it was trimmed and styled very meticulously. He was a little flamboyant while his girlfriend just seemed like she didn't care about her appearance one bit.

They're perfect for eachother, I guess. Jamie thought, as she decided to cut her losses. Even with a swapped personality, the two of them seemed just fine in their toxic destructive relationship. It was best to just leave them be before she got too crazy with more swapping...

-----------------------------------------------------

The next day Jamie picked up Anna on the way to school, and for the first time she was alone with her old friend from elementary school. But Anna had no idea that she was just 11 years old the day before. To her, she and Jamie were always the same age, and knew eachother for years.

"That was a weird night last night, I can't believe so many people showed up." Anna said from the passenger seat while Jamie drove.

"It wasn't supposed to be like that... But it wasn't a complete disaster, I guess." Jamie sighed, remembering that her mission had at least been successful getting Anna up in age. But was it worth it?

"I don't know, you seemed pretty distraught about it last night. Something really got to you. Do you still want to talk about it?"

"Well... someone there I kinda liked," Jamie started, realizing that in this reality she hadn't been dating Jeff, but she still felt the emotions left over from what had happened. "They were being kinda a dick and it really upset me. I... I think I'm completely over them now."

"Oh, does Jamie have a crush?" Anna teased, trying to lighten the situation.

"No way! Not anymore! I'm a single lady now, no one can stop me!" Jamie proclaimed, feeling a bit better saying it out loud.

Anna smiled, "Not for long I bet. Lots of guys, and some girls even, would kill to get on a date with you I'm sure."

Normally this would have been a nice thing to hear from a friend, but Jamie felt uncertain about that. She still wasn't used to being this... popular. She knew she could easily have the pick of anyone at the school by using the TSAR, but after Jeff, she wasn't sure that would ever end well. No, if she was going to find romance, she would have to find the right person, and do it the hard way. She didn't want another repeat of last night ever again.
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.title: Jamie swap Jeff and Alicia's feeling with e...

choices: Jamie looks up Casey on Facebook
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.content:
In the car on the way to school, Jamie took stock of Anna. Anna had grown into a very pretty woman. She had a killer body, a cute face and had a refined fashion sense. Jamie was proud of what she had done to Anna. Anna skipped all those awkward teenaged years. This reminded Jamie of Anna's 'sister' Billie.

"Hey, how's you sister?" Jamie inquired.

"You know how little sisters are."

"No really."

"Well she is at that boy crazy age. She falls in love with boy after boy although she hardly dates any. It's mostly in her head. You know how it is?"

"I do. It doesn't get any easier at our age."

"I suppose not. Although we do actually go on real dates. You have been avoiding it, what about this boy?"

"Oh, I just thought we had something, but we really didn't."

"When was the last time you went out?"

Jamie's dating history was wiped clean by 'dating' Jeff. Even though that relationship had never existed in the new reality, it wasn't replaced with Jamie dating anyone else during that time. "Ummm, it's been a while I suppose."

"You need to get out there. And I am here to help you!"

"You are?"

"Yeap, I'm going out with this guy, Scott. Let's make it a double date."

"But I don't have a date."

"Scott has a friend, Casey who I think is perfect for you."

What happens next?
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.title: Anna promises to help Jamie find a date the old...

choices: Jamie really likes the way Lauren looks in her new outfit.
They run into someone they know, out in the mall.
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.content:
Jamie gave it some thought and realized that there wasn't really any harm in trying. Maybe Casey would be nice? She didn't have to commit to a relationship, but she could give him a date, sure.

"Alright then, It's a date I guess," Jamie said.

"Well don't act so excited, jeez! Come on, it'll be fun! Look, we should go to the mall today, and each get a new outfit. I'm sure you have something you could wear already, but a new outfit will help you feel fresh and confident! It's like a new you going on this date, right?"

This made Jamie smile, "Yeah, I do think a new outfit would help. Maybe something to grab his attention huh?"

"Wow, you're already thinking that far ahead? Well if you insist, girl, but maybe take it slow as you get back into the dating world. You don't want to get in over your head." Anna advised.

Jamie sighed, "You're right... Maybe I need a second opinion on this outfit shopping thing... We should see if Lauren wants to come along? She always seems busy when we go shopping, and I don't want her to feel left out, she's been a good friend to me."

Anna nodded, as they pulled up to the school finally, 'It'll be good for that girl to get some new outfits herself, she always dresses so... conservatively, I don't know. Always with the long skirts and never anything adventurous."

----------------------------------------------------------------------

School went by quickly, and the three girls all met at the mall as soon as they could get there. They weren't sure if they could convince Lauren to come, but for once she seemed fine with coming along. Jamie was glad that the girl was finally coming out of her shell, and wanting to spend more time with friends.

"Hey everyone, sorry I'm a little late... You said we were going to go shopping? What for?" Lauren asked nervously as she approached Anna and Jamie.

Anna smiled, "Well... Jamie here has a blind-ish date, and she needs something to wear. And you my girl are a fashion disaster, no offense. So I figured I would treat you both to some shopping!"

Jamie just rolled her eyes. Lauren looked unsure, "I mean... sorry my outfits aren't very good. I know they're not. I just... I never find anything that really suits me, you know?"

"Don't worry! This is all about improvement, so, let's find you both something nice!" Anna declared as she led the way inside, making a beeline straight to the dress section. Anna had a great sense of style, and knew just what to look for. "So, Jamie, I know you want to dress to impress, but let me tell you that on a first date you don't want to go too overboard, alright? You don't want guys to get the wrong impression of you."

Jamie chuckled, "Sure, I guess you're right."

Anna continued, "And Lauren, you were on a date recently right? What did you wear to that?"

"Umm..." Lauren looked up in deep thought, "It was a long maxi skirt I think. Really comfortable!"

"Mhm... mhm... Right, but you know people can't even see your ankles when you wear that, right? Let alone your knees."

"Of course I know that I-"

"Right! So what's the harm in wearing something like this?" Anna said as she pulled a cute white and purple flowery dress off a rack, and held it up to Lauren. The hem came down to several inches above the knees, still completely tasteful as far as Anna was concerned. "I mean, you are going to have to start shaving your legs if you want to wear this out, but believe me it's worth it!"

Lauren frowned at the dress, "I... already do shave my legs, come on Anna. I'm not that clueless."

"Perfect! Then you'll have no problem looking amazing in this, go on, try it out!" Anna handed her the dress and motioned for her to head to the changing rooms. She was enjoying this way too much.

Jamie watched all of that with amusement, and enjoyed seeing Lauren awkwardly scamper off towards the changing room. But finally her attention was snapped away when Anna pulled her by the hand to another rack of dresses.

"Alright Jamie, you have a big date coming up, and you want to impress him, but you don't want to look too easy. It's a fine line, trust me." Anna rifled through the dresses looking for something suitable. "What's your favorite color, what do you look good in?"

Jamie gave it a good thought, "Well red is pretty nice."

"No no, red is too flashy for a first date..."

"How about purple?"

"Lauren just got a purple dress, come on! Be original!"

She was getting frustrated now, "Well what else do you want me to say those are my favorite colors! What about black? Black is always a good color for dresses."

Anna rolled her eyes, "Sure, if you want to be lazy about it, I guess black is nice..." She stopped to give Jamie a quick look from head to toe. "You know... with your blonde hair I want to say blue. Yeah, it will match perfectly!"

"But blue's a boy's color!" Jamie protested.

"Wow, really? You really need to grow up… It's a dress. In no way does that imply 'boy color'. Besides it's the 21st century, we can wear whatever color we want."

Jamie shrugged as Anna finally picked out a dress and handed it to her. It was a light blue, almost cyan, and was very different from how Jamie expected. She sighed and decided to trust Anna's judgement, and hurried to the dressing room.

She stripped down to her panties, and took off her bra because it would definitely show underneath this dress. Quickly and easily she slipped into the dress and it fit perfectly. Her toned waist was just narrow enough to not feel constricted, and her bust was only slightly too big for the ruched and wrinkled chest area. The dress was held up by thin string straps which wrapped around the back of her neck, and left her shoulders completely bare. She could see a modest amount of cleavage, just enough to catch someone's eye, but not enough to keep them staring non-stop.

Jamie grinned at herself in the mirror, liking how the color contrasted with her blonde hair. She had to admit… Anna was right. The hem of the skirt was just the right length, but she worried that with heels it might be a little too short. Which was a problem, because a dress like this would look awful when combined with flats… But for now, she walked out of the dressing room barefoot, to go see what Lauren's dress looked like, and to see what they thought of this!

1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.title: Jamie really likes the way Lauren looks in her ...

choices: Tomorrow, time for the double date!
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.content:
Lauren was beginning to look quite irritated at Jamie's line of questioning. "Look will you drop it already?! This isn't the time or place to talk about this! You KNOW this is a sensitive issue for me!" Lauren said not too loudly, trying not to make a scene.

Jamie backed up, "Whoa hey, I'm sorry. I know it's hard to talk about. You're right. I shouldn't talk about that so openly in public. Just keep what I said in mind, ok?"

Lauren folded her arms, almost looking cute despite her annoyed expression. And it didn't help that the dress she wore made her look even more adorable to Jamie. She couldn't take Lauren's frustration seriously anymore, and just smirked.

But then Anna came walking out of the dressing room, in a black dress which hugged her hips and rear tightly, forming to her curves but flaring out near the hem to give it a more retro look. The color black really went well with her dark tan skin color, giving her skin a bit of a shine in contrast to the dark material. And the top of the dress had a plunging neckline that went so low as to even show a bit of underboob in the cleavage. Anna looked confident as fuck in this dress, and Jamie was simply speechless.

"Wow... Anna, you're wearing THAT to the date? You told me it wasn't good to overdo it on the first date..." Jamie said, her eyes constantly being drawn towards Anna's chest.

"Yeah, but this isn't my first date with Scott, so I get to have some fun." She said with a wink.

Lauren seemed impressed as well, and seemed to forget all about being annoyed at Jamie suddenly. But that quickly turned to envy, as Lauren dearly wished she looked that good in a short dress and didn't have to worry about anything slipping out. "It's incredible Anna, you look beautiful in it, but how come yours is so much nicer?"

Anna laughed, "Cause I'm paying, duh! I'm picking up the tab for everyone, it's my treat. Maybe next time you can buy me something cute, and get yourself something tight and sexy. I mean, if that's your thing, anyway."

Jamie was sure Anna was just teasing Lauren about the tight and sexy thing, but it occured to her that maybe Anna wasn't aware of Lauren's secret after all? She was still trying to figure out Anna's social standing among her friends, ever since she became 18, but if Lauren never told Anna, then maybe they weren't as close friends as she was with Jamie?

"Well thank you so much for buying me this, I really don't mean to sound ungrateful, it's actually quite cute..." Lauren backtracked fairly quickly upon learning it was free. "Besides, I wouldn't look good in the dress you have anyway, this is better!"

Jamie nodded, "You look just fine Lauren, don't sweat it! And thanks again Anna, both for setting me up with this Casey, and for the dress, you're amazing as usual!"
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.title: Jamie decides to do nothing.

1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.content:
Jamie started to think about the TSAR. Yesterday Anna was a little eleven year old girl and today she not only was arranging double dates but she was treating everyone to dresses. Where did she get all this money? How did she get dates so quickly? Anna was a very friendly girl at an eleven year old and as an adult she was equally as popular. Jamie tried to think about what she knew about Anna. Not the old stuff when she was eleven but in this TSAR changed world.

Firstly Jamie realized that Anna was one of the most popular girls at school. She was even more popular than Kim who is a star athlete. Anna was involved in several clubs. She ran the bio and geo-scence club. She was part of the global navigators club. She was asked to be a cheerleader but she turned that down because she didn't have time. She of course was part of Arista and was on the ping pong team. She was vice-president in student government was working on a project that would be submitted to the Intel Science Talent Search. She was making money through her on-line blog too.

Everyone knew Anna and Anna seemed to know everyone. But with all that Jamie was proud that Anna was still her friend. Jamie wondered for a moment whether Anna would be just as successful if she had aged 'the normal way.' Or if Anna and her would be as good friends if Anna was actually born seven years before she had been. But that didn't matter, Anna was her friend and she was successful and Jamie thought it couldn't have happened to a nicer person.

"Anna, I just wanted to say I love you."

"I love you too."

"No I mean it. I treasure your friendship. I just wanted you to hear the words."

"Cut that out," Anna said with a smile. "You are going to make me blush."

"I love when you blush too." Which caused Anna to actually blush as she said she would.

"Break it up you two," Lauren said breaking the tension.

"I love you too." Jamie said. The three girls hugged each other in the store in a very warm embrace.

"Hey let's get home. We have dates to prepare for."

"Not me," Lauren said half jokingly.

"Oh don't worry. I have a guy for you too, He's perfect for you." Anna said. Anna did know everyone.

"Who???"

"I'll tell you later. Tonight is for Jamie."

What happens next?
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.title: Later in the evening.

choices: Skip straight to the start of the date.
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.content:
Jamie looked at Anna curiously, wondering if she really had a date set up for Lauren or if she was just stalling until she could find someone. Anna was just so conveniently on top of everything, she couldn't have thought that far ahead could she?

"Hey Anna, you know, so Lauren doesn't feel left out, why don't we make it a triple date tomorrow night? You have a date for her right? So it should be no problem to see if he can come too." Jamie pointed out to Anna.

At first, Anna looked caught off guard but went into thinking mode. "Yeah, it might work, depends on if he can change his plans last minute, but I'm sure I can convince him. For a girl like Lauren most guys would, I'm sure."

Lauren looked embarrassed, "Oh come on, if they really knew me, they wouldn't bother..."

"Lauren," Jamie sighed, "You just have to find the right one, don't get so down on yourself."

After discussing boys for a while longer, the night was already late, and the three girls split up and went back home to get ready for the next day. Jamie gave her new dress a quick wash and iron just to make sure it was as fresh as possible for tomorrow. And she spent the rest of the night getting freshly shaved and exfoliated. She wasn't sure why she was preparing so hard for a date with a guy she'd never met before, but first impressions should always be good, she believed.

While getting ready for bed, Jamie browsed her social media one last time as she always did, right before falling asleep. She got onto Anna's Facebook and found this Casey guy that she was meant to date tomorrow. It turns out he was already in Jamie's friends list, but as one of those 'friends' she'd never really talked to, but had merely friended just 'cause. After studying his page for a few minutes, she decided that this might not be so bad. He was nice looking and in shape, and seemed to have a lot of female friends who thought highly of him. Now Jamie just wondered what kind of guy Lauren was going to get set up with...

Tomorrow was Friday night and date night, so Jamie tried to go to sleep on time, so she would be prepared...
1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.title: Make it a triple date

1552112111112111113122222121331222213113.content:
Friday went by like a whirlwind, with Jamie running through her classes like she was on autopilot. As soon as she got home, she spent the remaining time she had left, getting her hair just right, and putting the finishing touches on her makeup. It wasn't long before it was time to pick up Anna and Lauren and the three of them would meet the three boys at the restaurant they were meeting up at. Jamie wasn't quite sure where the evening would go after that.

First, she picked up Lauren, who was neatly cleaned up and looking very cute in her new dress. She hadn't put in as much effort as Jamie had on her hair, but it was naturally straight and shiny, so it would certainly look just fine. When Jamie complimented her appearance multiple times, Lauren just clammed up and got all embarrassed, avoiding eye contact with Jamie the entire ride to Anna's house.

Anna, of course, looked stunning. Her short black dress and curly black hair blended in almost a sea of black, framing her expertly made-up face perfectly. Jamie suspected she went to get a professional makeover because it was just too perfect. Or maybe Anna just was that talented? She certainly didn't look this hot on an average day at school, but of course, this was a date, and she surely wanted to look her absolute best.

"Well, are you all ready?" Anna asked as they pulled up to the restaurant.

Jamie shrugged, a little nervous, but mostly just wanting to get it over with. "Sure."

Lauren was quiet, aside from a weak moan of confirmation. She didn't sound all that excited.

"Everything alright Laur?" Jamie asked, putting her hand on Lauren's shoulder.

"It's nothing, just a lot of people going to be at this date thing huh? 6 of us..?"

Anna sighed, "It's going to be ok hun, that's why we're going as a group, it's safer and more comfortable this way. Just remember half of the people here are your friends, and the other half could be new friends very soon! Don't worry about the rest of the people in the restaurant, tune them all out."

Once Lauren seemed like she was psyched up enough, the three girls got out of the car and saw two boys standing outside the restaurant, looking around anxiously. When they saw the three ladies approach, looking fabulous, they stood up straighter and adjusted their clothes to look more presentable.

"Heeyyyy Scott! Good to see you again!" Anna called out as she met up with her date, giving him a friendly hug. They seemed to be on familiar terms already. Scott was well dressed and charming, and didn't seem nervous at all.

The other boy standing there looked much less prepared. His shirt was untucked and a little wrinkled, and he wore jeans and sneakers like he'd just came straight from school. He didn't look unattractive, but he also didn't look like he put much effort in either. Standing next to the three ladies who'd all spent hours over the last few days, getting outfits and makeup prepared for their date, he looked like he was almost in rags.

"You're not... Casey? He's not here?" Jamie asked, not recognizing this boy as her date. She remembered Casey's facebook picture, and this was definitely not him.

"Na, I'm Aaron, sorry it was kind of a last minute thing, I was asked to show up. You both look incredible tonight, by the way. I guess, you're Lauren huh?" He said, answering Jamie, and then turning to Lauren with a wink.

Well at least he's attempting to be charming, even though his outfit doesn't reflect it. Jamie thought to herself.

Lauren nodded with a nervous smile, "Yeah, that's me! Nice to meet you Aaron. Sorry Anna dragged you into this, it was kinda sprung it on me too."

"It's cool! It looks like it worked out in the end, I can already tell this is going to be fun. Oh yeah and Casey should be here any minute, we're just waiting for our table to be ready and then we can go inside." Aaron told Lauren, and loud enough for Jamie to hear too. But the boy was most definitely focused on charming Lauren, and she was slowly trying to break the ice.

Then, as if on cue, a car pulled up with a bright green paint job, and neon lights underneath, tricked out like some kind of street racer. It parked and a guy casually got out and headed their way. Jamie hadn't connected it yet, but slowly realized who this must be. He wasn't dressed anything like his Facebook photo, but he still had the same blonde hair and charming look to him, despite the flashy clothes. He wore a very clean looking blue blazer with the school's logo printed on the front, over a white T-shirt and slacks. Everything looked carefully picked out and color coordinated. For a second Jamie admired his appearance, but a part of her thought maybe he was trying a bit too hard with the whole flashy entrance...

"Hey everyone! I see everyone's got their dates already, very nice. Oh, except you, my lovely Jamie." Casey said with a smirk, taking her hand and lifting it, and giving a polite tilt of his head while maintaining eye contact.

Jamie had no idea what he was doing, but this boy's confidence was quickly rubbing off on her. "Well, looks like I have my date now, Casey? Nice to uh, officially meet you. But I've seen you around already."

"Oh? Well I've certain seen you around, many times. Gotta say, you're probably the second most popular person in the school, it's hard not to see you around. Not that it's a bad thing by any means." Casey said with a shrug, letting her hand go.

"Well, I do know a lot of people, that's for sure. Umm yeah. So I guess our table is almost ready then?" Jamie wasn't sure how to respond to being called the 'second' most popular person in the school. She wasn't sure who he was implying was the most popular, but it was an odd backhanded compliment...

info.brief_description: Teen finds an alien artifact that can swap traits, but can have dangerous side effects.
info.description:
James Barrett is an average high school senior who stumbles on an artifact that blurs the line between advanced technology and magic. Before this his life was average and uneventful. James has a cute but insecure long term girlfriend, Lauren, who loves him, and he lives with his parents and brother and sister. He spends much of his time with his best friend Eric who he has known since kindergarten.

Then one day his life was changed by an artifact he assumes fell from space and is some kind of alien technology. He quickly discovers that it has the ability to change the people around him, even altering their minds.

The Ring:
Nicknamed TSAR, the artifact is a so-called Trait Swapping Alchemical Ring. The original name of it is unknown, but this is the name it calls itself in English when identifying itself to humans. The ring itself can change shape to fit on any finger, or even grow large enough to be worn like a bracelet or necklace. It looks like a very plain and unassuming accessory, made of a dark silver metal, but is polished smooth with no rough edges.

The Powers:
         - Swap physical traits between people
                   - Body parts, fitness, height, voice, or any other physical attributes you can imagine.
                   - Can choose to make the people swapped or the people around them unaware of change.
         - Swap clothing, wardrobes, or ownership of things in general.
                   - Can choose to adjust all affected clothing to resize to the new owner's body.
         - Swap mental traits between people or transfer from one to another.
                   - Individual memories, skills, knowledge, preferences, personality traits.
                   - Can transfer mental traits one way, where the sender loses trait and gets nothing in return.
         - CAN NOT alter reality. Can only change an individual's awareness of what is normal.
                   - Altering awareness on a mass scale is extremely difficult if not impossible for James to learn.


The User of the Ring Is:
         - Aware of physical and clothing changes he makes to himself or anyone else.
         - Some physical changes require some mental traits be swapped with them, like knowledge or habits required to maintain the new parts.
                   - The user of the ring may not notice these new mental traits if they subtle enough.
         - Unaware of memory swaps with his own memory, because he loses the memory of it in the swap.
         - Unaware of personality changes or preference changes made to himself, it changes how he thinks.


Major Characters:
James Barrett, 18 years old. 5'9", Shaggy light brown hair. The first person to find the TSAR. An average teen who is neither popular nor unpopular. He has a few close friends, mainly his cute and loyal girlfriend Lauren, and his best friend Eric. He has a wild imagination and likes fantasy and Sci-Fi. Can be impulsive and doesn't think before he leaps.

Eric Pierson, 18. 5'11", Hair shaved very short. James's best friend. An open and sociable person who makes friends easily. He cares about his friends more than himself. He distrusts anything to do with magic or aliens or the supernatural. He finds that he has an unexplainable immunity to all powers of the ring. Eric has a girlfriend, Kim, who he doesn't spend enough time with.

Lauren Tam, 18. 5'3", Long jet black hair, usually worn straight down. James's girlfriend and high school sweetheart. A short Korean American girl who is very close and devoted to James. She is a quiet and creative person, enjoying making art and playing music. She has low self-confidence and gets lonely easily, but is happier when around James.

Kim Weiss, 18. 5'8", Light blonde hair usually in a ponytail. Eric's outgoing and athletic girlfriend, who is one of the top volleyball players in the school. She has such a busy after school schedule that she hardly has time to see Eric anymore. She is quite a popular girl at school.

Audrey Barrett, 13. 5', James's sister. Long auburn hair. She is very energetic and loves to be the center of attention. She's fearless, self-centered, bratty, and spoiled. For a 7th grader she's very stylish and popular at school.

Jordan Barrett, 20. 6'1", James's brother. Short and trimmed brown hair. A college student who works part time and is rarely home. Parents praise him for being so successful at his age, comparing him to James. He has no girlfriend, but could get one if he actually tried.

Heather Barrett, 40. 5'6", James's mother. Long naturally red and stylish hair. Works as a middle school teacher at Audrey's school. Looks young for her age, and takes great care of her appearance, even dressing in the latest trends. Very active and social, often going out with friends.

Nick Barrett, 42. 6'2", James's father. Neat and short brown hair. Family oriented father who works a boring desk job to support his family. Spoils his daughter Audrey, and always compares James to Jordan's success getting into college.

Sara Pierson, 45. Eric's mother. 5'4", Shoulder length dark brown hair. A strict mother who never gives Eric a break. Works as a nurse.

Eddie Pierson, 49. Eric's father. 5'10", Short length brown hair. Not as strict as Eric's mother, but usually enforces her rules. He isn't very close with his son. Works in manufacturing.

Mrs. Adrianna (Areum in Korean) Tam, Lauren's mother 5'2, 43 y.o. she has dark brown eyes and black hair, she liked to go to the salon weekly to add waves to her mostly straight hair. She is a housewife and mother who wants to dote on her daughter, but she tries to restrain herself from over doing it. She and her husband talk in Koreran when alone, but mostly in English around her daughter

Mr. Charlie (Chiwon in Korean) Tam, Lauren's father 5'5, 46 y.o. He has brown eyes and short straight hair. He is an engineer who deeply loves his wife and family. He would rather spend the night at home with his wife watching TV than going out with the men at work or other couples. He considers himself to be the head of his household and likes to be in charge, but Mrs. Tam can influence him if it's important.

Story Rules:
No excessively explicit descriptions of sex or violence.
No chapters less than a few sentences.
No 'option chapters' unless they have story content in them.
No ending the story unless you have a good reason to.
You can add new powers to the ring as long as it doesn't contradict the rules already stated.
The ring may get stolen or be lost or given away. Whoever has the ring has the power.
